commit_message:
Remove obsolete binary packages from install

Since this repo is now completely RST docs based, we do not need the
tools for XML handling anymore, remove all the dependencies from
installation.

Add python-devel for RPM platforms.

Note that this test is self-testing - the new config will be used
directly in the OpenStack CI system.

Change-Id: I13f822b7f1f93fe16997c07671ea3ab18c006528

commit_message:
Update bindep.txt

Since we're not using XML anymore, remove now unused binary package
dependencies.

Add python-devel for RPM platforms.

Note that this test is self-testing - the new config will be used
directly in the OpenStack CI system.

Change-Id: If0195ba62a24ca1ce23b827bb2282099597b38e2

commit_message:
Ensure rsyslog restarts after configuration file changes

Added rsyslog restart handlers to each rsyslog_client_post_install task.
There was an issue when rsyslog_client_post_install would stop its service,
it would automatically get restarted and the service would not listen
for incoming logs. This now ensures that the rsyslog service will
be restarted after configuration files are changed.

Change-Id: I0cc9dd512fba6a1d583bf861a645097ae7c1d852
Partial-Bug: 1636017

commit_message:
Adds missing switch to rbac role function call to hypervisors compute test.

Currently, switchToRbacRole=True call is not executed for the
list_hypervisors test in test_hypervisors_rbac test. This patch
corrects this.

Change-Id: I8290e776adeb6447d6a5582d674c7d14972d66c8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/patrole refs/changes/68/437468/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from tempest import test if not test.is_extension_enabled('os-hypervisors', 'compute'): msg = "%s skipped as os-hypervisors extension not enabled." \ % cls.__name__ raise cls.skipException(msg) rbac_utils.switch_role(self, switchToRbacRole=True)
deleted_lines: from tempest import configCONF = config.CONF if not CONF.compute_feature_enabled.api_extensions: raise cls.skipException( '%s skipped as no compute extensions enabled' % cls.__name__)

commit_message:
Add spec for Accelerating SR-IOV with DPDK

bp accelerating-sriov-with-dpdk

Change-Id: I4ac2e9fe7ab1ea703e600ef5815fcb44a92f4a3a
Co-Authored-By: Steve Kipp <sk167v@att.com>
Co-Authored-By: Munish Mehan <munish.mehan@att.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/67/429867/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Accelerating SR-IOV with DPDK ========================================== Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/accelerating-sriov-with-dpdk By integrating DPDK PMD drivers with SR-IOV we can see significant improvement in NFV workloads. The virtual machines will be attached to hostdev devices which will increase the throughput for the NFV applications and help get as close to wire-line speed as possible for virtual machines. Problem description =================== Any application that cannot support high volume on the data traffic path needs significant improvement in performance for network data traffic. The typical performance of a vSwitch can be improved using features like SR-IOV and DPDK. Leveraging the features of theunderlying intel hardware, it comprises a set of lightweight software data plane libraries and optimized NIC drivers that can be modified for specifc applications that cannot handle high volumes on data traffic path. Along with SR-IOV this will enable the users to program the data path using DPDK. Use Cases --------- In addition to network performance, this proposed solution will allow operators to configure VFs at a more granular level with all the features available on cards and provide more flexibility to the NFV users. The operator can configure advanced features for the VFs on supported NICs like VLAN filtering, mac spoofing, multicast mode, QinQ, insert tag, strip tag, etc. Proposed change =============== In existing implementation we have a network segment bound to a port, and this network segment is a VLAN but with the ability to configure each VF. By integration of DPDK, the data from user applications avoid context switching and data copy associated with system calls. DPDK accelerated hardware enables the packets to bypass the Kernel entirely. Operators can configure multiple segments and much more configurations on each VF and use the same provider physical network which maps to a NIC that can have 32 VFs The physical network maps to the pci_whitelist option found in the nova.conf configuration file. Diagram ------- asciiflow:: 1. + +----------------------------+ | | Controller Node | | | | | | | | | +------------+ | | | | Neutron | | | | | +------+ | | | | | | API | | | +-----------> | | | | | +------+ | | | | | | | | | | | | | | +-----------------------------+ | +------------+ | | Compute Node | 2. | | | | + | +--------------------+ | | +-----------------+ | | | | Nova | | | | Nova Compute | | | | | +------+ +-------+ | | | | | | | | | | API | | Server| | | | | +-------------+ | | +-----------> 3.+--> 4. | | | | | | Manager | | | | | +------+ +--+----+ | | | | | 6. | | | | | | | | | | | +---------+ | | +-----+| | | +-------v--+ | | | | | | libvrt | | | | DPDK|| | | | Scheduler| | | | | | | Driver7.+-----> 8. || | | | 5.+-- +---------> +---------+ | | | || | | +----------| | | | | +-------------+ | +-+---+| | +--------------------+ | | +-----------------+ | | | | | 9.| | +----------------------------+ | | | | +-----------------------+ | | | Vf+agent | | | | | +------+ | | | | | | IPLEX| | | | | | | 10. <------+ | | | | +---+--+ | | | | | | | | | | | | | | +-----v-----+ | | | | | Vf+daemon | | | | | | | | | | | +-----------+ | | | | | | | | | | | | | | +--+-----------------------+--+ Workflow -------- Assuming a user created a VLAN network 1. User sends the binding profile information to the neutron client in a port create request. .. code-block:: bash openstack port create --name demo_sriov f0ddb971-609e-45a8-9c4d-d6e08a5f0e6d\ --binding:vnic_type direct --binding:profile type=utils.json2dict\ '{"VF_VLAN_FILTER": [207], "INSERT_STAG": false, "VF_BROADCAST_ALLOW":\ true ,"VF_UNKNOWN_MULTICAST_ALLOW": true, "VF_UNKNOWN_UNICAST_ALLOW":\ true, "LINK_STATUS": true ,"VF_VLAN_STRIP": true}' 2. User sends the port id information to the nova client in a boot request .. code-block:: bash openstack server create --flavor m1.small --image ubuntu_14.04\ --nic port-id==$port_id --availability-zone vfa VMname 3. Openstack Client sends boot request to nova server 4. Nova server sends a notification to nova scheduler 5. The nova scheduler selects host that is capable of supporting PCI Passthrough 6. Nova Scheduler sends a notification to nova manager on compute 7. The nova manager generates the vm configuration and adds the hostdev devices and DPDK driver to include the PCI VFs 8. Nova Compute updates the port information by retrieving the information from the port ID in the request. 9. Nova Compute configures virtual functions by generating a configuration file that IPLEX[1] uses to bind the port[2]. 10. IPLEX passes the information to the VF Daemon[3] to complete the requested operations. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- The parameters in the binding profile need to be exposed to Neutron. --binding:profile "{ "VLAN_FILTER": [100], "MAC_FILTER": ["de:ad:be:ef:co:fe"], "VLAN_ANTI_SPOOF_CHECK": true, "BROADCAST_ALLOW": true, "VLAN_STRIP": true, "UNKOWN_UNICAST_ALLOW": true, "MAC_ANTI_SPOOF_CHECK": true, "INSERT_STAG": true, "UNKOWN_MULTICAST_ALLOW": true, "LINK_STATUS": "auto" }" Security impact --------------- IPLEX will be added to rootwrap Users will have to provide data to configure ports. Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ Networking with SR-IOV will see significant improvements by using this feature because DPDK's poll mode mitigates interrupts. Other deployer impact --------------------- SR-IOV and Huge pages need to be configured at compute hosts. The DPDK application[4] that configures VFs needs to be deployed. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: twm2016 Other contributors: sk167v Work Items ---------- The proposed changes discussed earlier will be the work items. Dependencies ============ VFd is distributed in a ".deb" package and can be installed with a simple "dpkg" command. The installation creates the configuration directory under /etc and adds the sample configuration file. The DPDK VF Daemon code can be broken up into these dependencies: * VFd the daemon itself (64 bit Linux binary) * IPLEX (The command line tool used to communicate with VFd (python 2.x) Testing ======= A positive test case scenario should be ran with specialized hardware that provides a 10 gigabit ethernet controller. Vendor specific CI should be added for each supporited NIC card. Documentation Impact ==================== There will be documentation impact as we need to include in the openstack neutron manual that SRIOV is capable of supporting DPDK enabled applications. The author and the extended existing SRIOV/Intel team will work with neutron documentation in including this feature. References ========== [1] https://github.com/att/vfd/blob/master/src/system/iplex [2] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/ml2-binding-profile [3] https://github.com/att/vfd/wiki [4] https://github.com/att/vfd/tree/master/doc/operations

This reverts commit 9915e4bfe6e7b711b8366cb36877651aa032ba8e.

This is failing due to other projects having python3 failures and is
blocking the neutron gate.

commit_message:
Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: If9a737676cd82f5e2170042da71f241ff35a0edb

commit_message:
Updates Tempest.conf.j2

Some options inside the tempest configuration template
have been deprecated. This patch updates the
configuration options in the tempest.conf.j2 file.

Change-Id: I45089992049086300994663e7a088799738dcaf8
Closes-Bug: #1642749
(cherry picked from commit 9a42e0c707f247594885a378c5af14cce99dc389)

commit_message:
import theme locally

Rather than relying on oslosphinx to provide the theme, move the files
here. This allows us to make local customizations for the governance
site.

Change-Id: I43440a0528e6b2d91b8cdc6b3389448d51834dac
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Rename DefCore Committee -> Interop Working Group

At the Board of Directors meeting on April 24, 2016 the Board of
Directors indicated that as DefCore has evolved it's focus on
interoperability and it's working structure, it's name may be a
source of some confusion to those outside of the community or who are new
to the community.  The Board made an informal request that the DefCore
Committee consider changing it's name to more clearly reflect it's
focus and structure.  In August of 2016, the Board passed a resolution
renaming the group to "The Interop Working Group".[1]

Since then, the Interop Working Group has completed a series of changes
to it's documentation and public resources to reflect it's new name.[2]
The next step in the process is to rename the project's resources in
infra, including it's git repository and associated artifacts.[3]  This
This commit modifies a few remaining governance artifacts that referece
DefCore to use the new name/artifacts instead.  Past TC resolutions
referencing DefCore have been ommitted to preserve historical context.

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Governance/Foundation/23Aug2016BoardMinutes
[2] For example: http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/defcore/commit/?id=d8fb682a2bd17c111f5dd4f8341fb1b300ac2d4d
[3] https://review.openstack.org/433414

Change-Id: I4f5d415f31c9976a001e318c7ae4dc9f9651e215

commit_message:
Remove smoke tag for TelemetryNotificationAPITest

It doesn't make sense to run this test by default since Ceilometer API
is deprecated.

As a user who follows Telemetry deprecations, I don't want to run this
test by default.

Change-Id: Ib7aaf876a8bc198f0134e86449aec09ff0db23e1

commit_message:
Stop carrying upstream files

In our roles we carry files for templating that are included in
the upstream repos.

In the role testing, we don't need these files, as they can be
fetched from upstream url (see the defaults/main.yml).

This patch focuses on policy.json removal.

Change-Id: I60e68acc82382cbbf319067264d401122bd11392

commit_message:
Deprecate ceilometer-collector

Per https://review.openstack.org/#/c/413920/, the ceilometer-collector
service is now deprecated.
This commit removes the inventory group mappings to the
ceilometer-collector service/container. It also removes
the service from the bootstrap and testing inventory.
Gnocchi is now explicity used as a publisher in the
pipeline.

Partial-Bug: 1666238
Change-Id: I396b154d106c0afba44d57792ae6dad39b33a6f5

commit_message:
VMware: store vCenter user/password in Keystone

Spec for a method by which the VMware driver can fetch the vCenter
user/password from the Keystone credential store rather than
nova.conf.

Change-Id: I7a38431edd0f369e80cc561e2f184f0fa1ebd7d5
Blueprint: vmware-encrypt-vcenter-passwords
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/80/234480/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================================================= VMware: Storage of vCenter passwords in Keystone credential store ================================================================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/vmware-encrypt-vcenter-passwords This blueprint is proposal for how vCenter passwords can be securely stored in the keystone credential store rather than as plain text in the nova.conf file. Problem description =================== Today there are two config options representing the credentials necessary for the VMware driver to properly communicate with the vCenter Server. They are: host_username and host_password. The primary concern of some deployers is that the vCenter usernames and passwords are stored in plain text inside the nova.conf file. This problem statement only applies to the VMware credenitals stored in nova.conf. It does not attempt to address the more general issue of plain text passwords being stored in *.conf files. Use Cases ---------- As a deployer, I wish to configure Nova for the VMware driver using my user/password stored in a secure manner. Proposed change =============== The proposed solution is to utilize the leverage the existing keystone crednetial store a repository for the vCenter user/password. The flow would be as follows: - The openstack command line is used to create a new credential for the nova user in keystone's credential store (openstack credential create). - The values in nova.conf for host_username and host_password are left empty. - When the VMware Nova driver starts it will fetch the user and password from Keystone if they are undefined in nova.conf. The Keystone credential store is a v3 API, so there is a dependency on Nova using this version. Also, note that is it not required that the username and password to be stored in this credential store. A deployer may still put these values in the nova.conf. Alternatives ------------ Some suggestions have been to use Barbican for storing credentials. But not all deployments have Barbican. Unlike Barbican, Keystone is always required in order to deploy OpenStack. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- The deployer needs to make use of the openstack command line in order to create a credential for the vCenter user/password. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: ericwb Other contributors: None Work Items ---------- Should be a single work item (patch) to update the VMware driver to fetch the vCenter user/password from the Keystone credential store when undefined in nova.conf. Dependencies ============ Nova must be using the keystone middleware which supports the Keystone v3 API. This dependency should already be satisfied. Testing ======= The testing should be rather straightforward. A deployment should be tested with and without the user/password of vCenter in the Keystone credential store and verify communication of the driver to vCenter still works properly. Documentation Impact ==================== The deployment flow described above should be documented as an alternative way of deploying the VMware compute driver in a more secure manner. References ========== None History ======= None

commit_message:
add filename and sha in comments in report output

Add debugging details with the filename and sha for the version of the
content used so that each note that comes out in the report indicates
where the content is from.

Change-Id: I569f3dbd3df16f880c8f3fa0a1b5b1c1b77be45d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Added built venvs to the release manifest

This change adds the release venvs to the built manifest.in file. This
change will allow a deployer to sync the constructed venv archive into
deployments from an external source.

Change-Id: Idaaae0ac5ab2e7cec94fa4aa3a008ec04acc684c
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Benchmark requests during upgrade testing

During upgrade testing, move Keystone containers behind an HAProxy
load balancer and run a benchmarking tool to make continuous requests
against the keystone API, providing summary output at the end of the
play. This should help ensure the upgrade process between releases
remains without downtime.

To avoid service interruptions because of files being replaced during
installations:
  - set the 'keystone_venv_tag' var so that it changes between releases
  - perform the 'Create WSGI symlinks' task only after the files being
    linked to exist

Benchmarking scripts were provided by:
https://github.com/lbragstad/keystone-performance-upgrade

Co-Authored-By: Lance Bragstad <lbragstad@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Dolph Mathews <dolph.mathews@gmail.com>

Combined backport of:
https://review.openstack.org/437996
https://review.openstack.org/432391
https://review.openstack.org/432413
https://review.openstack.org/432426

Change-Id: I462e6496f125c7e263bbab188e86c45e1f4f7f1e
(cherry picked from commit 52506b8f988298fb3c6bd977396e102e3f82f472)

subject: Enable ntp client functionality with chronyd
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-23 21:22:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-security/commit/61b4b162732fd25f009d58d6f9cd924386186c3e', 'message': "Author: Shannon Mitchell <shannon.mitchell@rackspace.com>
Date: Thu Feb 23 21:00:20 UTC 2017

Enable ntp client functionality with chronyd

Using 'bindaddress' in the /etc/chrony/chrony.conf disables both client and
server ntp functionality as it cannot get the ntp responses from peer servers.
The default install will leave the servers unsynced with an ntp source causing
them to skew over time and eventually break services that rely on synced time.
Setting 'port 0' will disable the server functionality.  Using 'bindcmdaddress'
will still chronc<->chronyd communictions over localhost only.  This should
allow client functionality and disable server functionality.

Change-Id: Ie9b6e73333d9469a17e4cee06f21aa99b2b3df7e
Closes-Bug: #1656086
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-23 21:25:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-security/commit/1fbdf7dfac52e54d09b8a0edcc045cbf99aa06c9', 'message': "Author: Shannon Mitchell <shannon.mitchell@rackspace.com>
Date: Thu Feb 23 21:00:20 UTC 2017

Enable ntp client functionality with chronyd

Using 'bindaddress' in the /etc/chrony/chrony.conf disables both
client and server ntp functionality as it cannot get the ntp
responses from peer servers.  The default install will leave the
servers unsynced with an ntp source causing them to skew over time
and eventually break services that rely on synced time.  Setting
'port 0' will disable the server functionality.  Using 'bindcmdaddress'
will still chronc<->chronyd communictions over localhost only.  This
should allow client functionality and disable server functionality.

Change-Id: Ie9b6e73333d9469a17e4cee06f21aa99b2b3df7e
Closes-Bug: #1656086
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-23 21:28:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-security/commit/5550914fd44b51002f2469fbf387abb235e31a5f', 'message': "Author: Shannon Mitchell <shannon.mitchell@rackspace.com>
Date: Thu Feb 23 21:00:20 UTC 2017

Enable ntp client functionality with chronyd

Using 'bindaddress' in the /etc/chrony/chrony.conf disables both
client and server ntp functionality as it cannot get the ntp
responses from peer servers.  The default install will leave the
servers unsynced with an ntp source causing them to skew over
time and eventually break services that rely on synced time.
Setting 'port 0' will disable the server functionality.  Using
'bindcmdaddress' will still chronc<->chronyd communictions over
localhost only.  This should allow client functionality and
disable server functionality.

Change-Id: Ie9b6e73333d9469a17e4cee06f21aa99b2b3df7e
Closes-Bug: #1656086
"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2017-02-24 16:15:23.000000000', 'files': ['templates/chrony.conf.j2'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-security/commit/4cb2fa4eaa5a2b2d282f9292b1a19f79fcb5ebbb', 'message': "Enable ntp client functionality with chronyd

Using 'bindaddress' in the /etc/chrony/chrony.conf disables both
client and server ntp functionality as it cannot get the ntp
responses from peer servers.  The default install will leave the
servers unsynced with an ntp source causing them to skew over
time and eventually break services that rely on synced time.
Setting 'port 0' will disable the server functionality.  Using
'bindcmdaddress' will still chronc<->chronyd communictions over
localhost only.  This should allow client functionality and
disable server functionality.

Change-Id: Ie9b6e73333d9469a17e4cee06f21aa99b2b3df7e
Closes-Bug: #1656086
"}]
commit_message:
Enable ntp client functionality with chronyd

Using 'bindaddress' in the /etc/chrony/chrony.conf disables both
client and server ntp functionality as it cannot get the ntp
responses from peer servers.  The default install will leave the
servers unsynced with an ntp source causing them to skew over
time and eventually break services that rely on synced time.
Setting 'port 0' will disable the server functionality.  Using
'bindcmdaddress' will still chronc<->chronyd communictions over
localhost only.  This should allow client functionality and
disable server functionality.

Change-Id: Ie9b6e73333d9469a17e4cee06f21aa99b2b3df7e
Closes-Bug: #1656086

added_lines: Bandwidth limit is supported on OVS, Linux Bridge, and SR-IOV mechanism drivers. For the Newton release onward DSCP marking will be supported on the OVS mechanism driver, and the minimum bandwidth rules on the SR-IOV NIC mechanism driver.You can incorporate minimum bandwidth rules to your policy: .. code-block:: console $ neutron qos-policy-create bandwidth-control $ neutron qos-minimum-bandwidth-rule-create bandwidth-control \ --min-kbps 10000 --direction egress Created a new minimum_bandwidth_rule: +-----------+--------------------------------------+ | Field | Value | +-----------+--------------------------------------+ | direction | egress | | id | 33452261-2008-475f-a852-3b1ef3684bbc | | min_kbps | 10000 | +-----------+--------------------------------------+ $ neutron qos-bandwidth-limit-rule-create bandwidth-control --max-kbps 50000 Created a new bandwidth_limit_rule: +----------------+--------------------------------------+ | Field | Value | +----------------+--------------------------------------+ | id | 76695f30-bdaf-4a3c-88b1-dfa4072ecd7e | | max_burst_kbps | 0 | | max_kbps | 50000 | +----------------+--------------------------------------+ $ neutron qos-policy-show bandwidth-control +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------------------+ | Field | Value | +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------------------+ | created_at | 2017-02-14T14:45:04Z | | description | | | id | 80e23e74-745d-422d-a123-b15bc798bcba | | name | bandwidth-control | | project_id | 3ef38fd59b224ad08b86126cdcedb570 | | revision_number | 3 | | rules | 76695f30-bdaf-4a3c-88b1-dfa4072ecd7e (type: bandwidth_limit) | | | 33452261-2008-475f-a852-3b1ef3684bbc (type: minimum_bandwidth) | | shared | False | | tenant_id | 3ef38fd59b224ad08b86126cdcedb570 | | updated_at | 2017-02-14T14:51:02Z | +-----------------+----------------------------------------------------------------+ A policy with a minimum bandwidth limit rule guarantees bandwidth to the port as long as the hypervisor has enough bandwidth to met all the guarantees.

commit_message:
Add checks in ansible upgrade tasks for CephMon and CephOSD

Adds two checks, one for the CephMon and one for the CephOSD upgrade
tasks borrowed from ceph-ansible.

Change-Id: I0a0e60d277240130c6bd76a74ccc13354b87a30a
Co-Authored-By: Sebastien Han <seb@redhat.com>

This just moves the dev guidelines into the Getting Involved page,
in preparation to get it moved up and be one of the first pages for
folks to read.

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/65/437565/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: ******************** Developer Guidelines ******************** Example DNS Names and IP Space ============================== The IANA has allocated several special purpose domains and IP blocks for use as examples in code and documentation. Where possible, these domains and IP blocks should be preferred. There are some cases where it will not be possible to follow this guidance, for example, there is currently no reserved IDN domain name. We prefer to use these names and IP blocks to avoid causing any unexpected collateral damage to the rightful owners of the non-reserved names and IP space. For example, publishing an email address in our codebase will more than likely be picked up by spammers, while published URLs etc using non-reserved names or IP space will likely trigger search indexers etc to begin crawling. Reserved Domains ---------------- Reserved DNS domains are documented here: `IANA Special Use Domain Names`_. Several common reserved domains: * example.com. * example.net. * example.org. Reserved IP Space ----------------- Reserved IP space is documented here: `IANA IPv4 Special Registry`_, and `IANA IPv6 Special Registry`_. Several common reserved IP blocks: * 192.0.2.0/24 * 198.51.100.0/24 * 203.0.113.0/24 * 2001:db8::/32 .. _IANA Special Use Domain Names: http://www.iana.org/assignments/special-use-domain-names/special-use-domain-names.xhtml .. _IANA IPv4 Special Registry: http://www.iana.org/assignments/iana-ipv4-special-registry/iana-ipv4-special-registry.xhtml .. _IANA IPv6 Special Registry: http://www.iana.org/assignments/iana-ipv6-special-registry/iana-ipv6-special-registry.xhtml Style Guide =========== Follow `OpenStack Style Guidelines <http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/>`_ File header ----------- Start new files with the following. Replace where needed: .. code-block:: python # Copyright <year> <company> # # Author: <name> <email addr> # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """ <package.module> ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ <Describe what the module should do, especially interactions with other components and caveats> <Optional links> `Specs: Refer to a spec document if relevant`_ `User documentation <FILL_THIS.html>`_ <Refer to files under doc/> <This is useful to remind developers to keep the docs up to date> """ Example: .. code-block:: rst backend.impl_akamai ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Akamai backend. Create and delete zones on Akamai. Blah Blah... `Specs: Keystone Session <https://github.com/openstack/designate-specs/blob/master/specs/kilo/switch-to-keystone-session.rst>`_ `User documentation <backend.html>`_ When updating a module, please ensure that the related user documentation is updated as well. Docstrings ---------- Use the Sphinx markup. Here is an example: .. code-block:: python class MyClass(object): """<description> mention a function :func:`foo` or a class :class:`Bar` """ def function(self, foo): """<describe what the function does> :param foo: <description> :type foo: <type> :returns: <describe the returned value> :rtype: <returned type> :raises: <list raised exceptions> :Example: >>> a = b - c >>> <more Python code> .. note:: <add a note here> .. seealso:: <blah> .. warning:: <use sparingly> """ Logging ------- See http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html .. code-block:: python # Do not use "%" string formatting # No localization for debug LOG.debug("... %s", variable) LOG.info(_LI("... %s..."), variable) # Use named interpolation when more than one replacement is done LOG.info(_LI("... %(key)s ..."), {'key': 'value', ...}) LOG.warn(_LW("... %(key)s"), {'key': 'value'}) LOG.error(_LE("... %(key)s"), {'key': 'value'}) LOG.critical(_LC("... %(key)s"), {'key': 'value'})

commit_message:
Cap the number of worker threads

Users can configure the number of worker threads however when it's
not specified the calculated number of workers can get too large on
hosts with a large number of CPUs.

Combined backport of:
https://review.openstack.org/424125
https://review.openstack.org/437318

Change-Id: I01af5ef83698231137b972b9a6d504d6f99eabaf
(cherry picked from commit 4d8032ab62dc27206b07f4f167b6b324dc778565)

As of the following project-config change, this file is no longer used:

https://review.openstack.org/394684

Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/63/435663/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines:
# Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # # This script is executed in the tempest-dsvm-networking-ovn-native-services # OpenStack CI job that runs DevStack + tempest using OVN's native l3, # native dhcp, and eventually other native OVN services. # You can find the CI job configuration here: # # http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-infra/project-config/tree/jenkins/jobs/networking-ovn.yaml # export OVERRIDE_ENABLED_SERVICES=key,n-api,n-cpu,n-cond,n-sch,n-crt,n-cauth,n-obj,placement-api,g-api,g-reg,c-sch,c-api,c-vol,horizon,rabbit,mysql,dstat,ovn-northd,ovn-controller,q-svc if [ -z "${RALLY_SCENARIO}" ] ; then # Only include tempest if this is not a rally job. export OVERRIDE_ENABLED_SERVICES=${OVERRIDE_ENABLED_SERVICES},tempest fi export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"OVN_L3_CREATE_PUBLIC_NETWORK=True" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"Q_USE_PROVIDERNET_FOR_PUBLIC=True" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"PHYSICAL_NETWORK=public" export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"OVN_NATIVE_DHCP=True" if [[ "$DEVSTACK_GATE_TOPOLOGY" == "multinode" ]] ; then # NOTE(rtheis): Multinode does not require creating an OVN L3 public network. export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"OVN_L3_CREATE_PUBLIC_NETWORK=False" # NOTE(rtheis): Configure the enabled services on the compute node. export DEVSTACK_SUBNODE_CONFIG+=$'
'"ENABLED_SERVICES=n-cpu,dstat,c-vol,c-bak,ovn-controller" # NOTE(rtheis): Configure OVN on the compute node. export DEVSTACK_SUBNODE_CONFIG+=$'
'"OVN_NATIVE_DHCP=True" export DEVSTACK_SUBNODE_CONFIG+=$'
'"OVN_SB_REMOTE=tcp:\$SERVICE_HOST:6642" export DEVSTACK_SUBNODE_CONFIG+=$'
'"OVN_NB_REMOTE=tcp:\$SERVICE_HOST:6641" # NOTE(rtheis): Since we are overriding the enabled services, we must # also configure the database and rabbit services on the compute node. export DEVSTACK_SUBNODE_CONFIG+=$'
'"DATABASE_HOST=\$SERVICE_HOST" export DEVSTACK_SUBNODE_CONFIG+=$'
'"DATABASE_TYPE=mysql" export DEVSTACK_SUBNODE_CONFIG+=$'
'"RABBIT_HOST=\$SERVICE_HOST" else export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'
'"OVN_L3_CREATE_PUBLIC_NETWORK=True" fi # Begin list of exclusions. r="^(?!.*" # exclude the slow tag (part of the default for 'full') r="$r(?:.*\[.* slow .*\])" # TODO(chandrav): Opened bug #1629073 to track this r="$r|(?:tempest\.scenario\.test_network_v6.*)" # exclude things that just aren't enabled with OVN r="$r|(?:tempest\.api\.network\.admin\.test_l3_agent_scheduler.*)" r="$r|(?:tempest\.api\.network\.admin\.test_quotas\.QuotasTest\.test_lbaas_quotas.*)" r="$r|(?:tempest\.api\.network\.test_load_balancer.*)" r="$r|(?:tempest\.scenario\.test_load_balancer.*)" r="$r|(?:tempest\.api\.network\.admin\.test_load_balancer.*)" r="$r|(?:tempest\.api\.network\.admin\.test_lbaas.*)" r="$r|(?:tempest\.api\.network\.test_fwaas_extensions.*)" r="$r|(?:tempest\.api\.network\.test_metering_extensions.*)" r="$r|(?:tempest\.thirdparty\.boto\.test_s3.*)" # exclude dhcp agent tests r="$r|(?:tempest\.api\.network\.admin\.test_dhcp_agent_scheduler.*)" # exclude this test case because this expects dhcp interface to be present r="$r|(?:tempest\.scenario\.test_network_basic_ops\.TestNetworkBasicOps\.test_port_security_macspoofing_port)" # exclude this test because there are no agents used by OVN r="$r|(?:tempest\.api\.network\.admin\.test_agent_management.*)" # exclude some unrelated stuff to make networking-ovn targeted runs go faster r="$r|(?:tempest\.api\.identity*)" r="$r|(?:tempest\.api\.image*)" r="$r|(?:tempest\.api\.volume*)" r="$r|(?:tempest\.api\.compute\.images*)" r="$r|(?:tempest\.api\.compute\.keypairs*)" r="$r|(?:tempest\.api\.compute\.certificates*)" r="$r|(?:tempest\.api\.compute\.flavors*)" r="$r|(?:tempest\.api\.compute\.test_quotas*)" r="$r|(?:tempest\.api\.compute\.test_versions*)" r="$r|(?:tempest\.api\.compute\.volumes*)" # End list of exclusions. r="$r)" # only run tempest.api/scenario/thirdparty tests (part of the default for 'full') r="$r(tempest\.(api|scenario|thirdparty)).*$" export DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_REGEX="$r"

commit_message:
Include the auth_url in the discovery failure message

The failed to discover message pops up a lot because it means that we
didn't get a sensible response to the version list request a plugin
makes. Debugging this can be a pain, but it's easier if we at least know
the URL that failed to be called.

Change-Id: Ibaa89b43b23ebacb72f441fde01dfd79b927f977

commit_message:
libvirt: drop MIN_QEMU_PPC64_VERSION

The minimum required QEMU (2.1.0) matches this now
so we can drop the compatibility code.

Change-Id: I45cf862c6900337082d38bc6bb8902d7c5815d99

commit_message:
Address db_sync check against new install

This patch fixes a bug and causes a log message along with an exit
code to be returned when a DBMigration error is raised.

Change-Id: Iba7aff606937561ad98e2ef551ca4005bd4f337d
Closes-Bug: #1663627

commit_message:
Check for libvirt group before adding nova user

Upgrades fail because the libvirt group name has changed in Ubuntu. This
patch will check whether the group exists before attempting to do the
group add.

Change-Id: I4a3b61d346c72923804d8f86ea763c0e3fce30be

commit_message:
Cap the number of worker threads

Users can configure the number of worker threads however when it's
not specified the calculated number of workers can get too large on
hosts with a large number of CPUs.

Change-Id: I6c950cc31b66479dc980ecd5eb580d403dd27ae6
(cherry picked from commit f83296e07387affab9364b273c999f292e8c9905)

commit_message:
Reload nginx instead of restart

We don't need to restart nginx - we can instead just reload the
service. Additionally, as more services move to use nginx frontend, it
would be bad to restart all NGinx services at the same time.

For now we need to investigate the impact of reloads in UWsgi before
moving over to a "reload" on UWsgi.

Change-Id: I60e370e784a1ff3a0f5bf8551be804bf05d8bb43

commit_message:
Respond icmp unreachable message with rate limit(L3 app)

This patch adds static icmp responder for each router interface and
openflow rule for each router interface.

If the router interface is concrete, the packet will be sent to EGRESS_TABLE.
If the router interface is virtual, the packet will be sent to local
controller. And local controller will respond icmp unreachable message.

Conflicts:
        dragonflow/controller/l3_app.py

Change-Id: I5bfaeb013bf1adb0b4b81c82450d89ab17d23a67
Partially-implements: blueprint traceroute-support
(cherry picked from commit 9f456ed1d81ff2e53383e0e0710bea76a08ef456)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/08/436008/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.assertEqual(5, self.mock_mod_flow.call_count) # Since there is only one router interface in the fake router. # Adding router will call mod_flow 2 times less than deleting router. def test_reply_icmp_unreachable_with_rate_limit(self): self.app.router_port_rarp_cache = mock.Mock() self.app.router_port_rarp_cache.values.return_value = ["10.0.0.1"] event = mock.Mock() fake_ip_pkt = mock.Mock() fake_ip_pkt.dst = "10.0.0.1" fake_pkt = mock.Mock() fake_pkt.get_protocol.return_value = fake_ip_pkt with mock.patch("ryu.lib.packet.packet.Packet", return_value=fake_pkt): with mock.patch("dragonflow.controller.common" ".icmp_error_generator.generate") as icmp_error: self.app.packet_in_handler(event) self.app.packet_in_handler(event) self.app.packet_in_handler(event) self.app.packet_in_handler(event) self.assertEqual(self.app.conf.router_port_unreach_max_rate, icmp_error.call_count) icmp_error.assert_called_with(icmp.ICMP_DEST_UNREACH, icmp.ICMP_PORT_UNREACH_CODE, mock.ANY, pkt=fake_pkt)

Add E128 to pep8 check list

Unlike E126, which is controversial, E128 is a check should be applied
to code.

E128 continuation line under-indented for visual indent

Partial-Bug: #1663864

commit_message:
Cap the number of worker threads

Users can configure the number of worker threads however when it's
not specified the calculated number of workers can get too large on
hosts with a large number of CPUs.

Change-Id: I039993d28dbddbd43ffcb2a6f84785df475fefeb
(cherry picked from commit 4253b61abf2c3beaae8c9bd4cb3ba402ad90a9d6)

added_lines: --- features: - Capping the default value for the variable ``keystone_wsgi_processes`` to 16 when the user doesn't configure this variable. Default value is half the number of vCPUs available on the machine with a capping value of 16.

commit_message:
Enable placement section on controller in multinode setup

Currently placement api section will be configured on controller
only if service n-cpu is running. It breaks multi node setup.
Closes-Bug: #1667219

Change-Id: I8b0f60f253859f704bb9831d7dac8f55df353ac7

commit_message:
Split upgrade testing into it's own shell script

This will separate out the runs so that variables and modules are not
re-used across runs - ensuring the latest modules and versions are used,
and ensuring multiple versions of the tests playbook aren't required on
non-upgrade runs.

Change-Id: Icaeb360a6302ff207d970c0c6fe8e56add1e1327

not specified the calculated number of workers can get too large on
hosts with a large number of CPUs.

Change-Id: Idda6e476e9e9b5842c4cc03e9853ec31d123abc5
(cherry picked from commit 33e7ad04003ec0d05469ca6b591d329f043dc21d)

deleted_lines: # If ``repo_nginx_threads`` is unset the system will use half the number of available VCPUS to # compute the number of api workers to use. # repo_nginx_threads: 16

commit_message:
Get/Set power state fails

It's possible for iDRACs to get into a state where the Name element is
not returned when querying DCIM_ComputerSystem.  This results in the
get_power_state command failing against nodes with iDRACs in this
state.

This patch removes selecting on the Name element from get_power_state.
This makes get_power_state work against both nodes with iDRACs in this
state and iDRACs not in this state.

Change-Id: Ide2d69b695376c777e5c4ee847dd0e481474a09f
Closes-Bug: #1667088
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-dracclient refs/changes/32/437132/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: filter_query = ('select EnabledState from DCIM_ComputerSystem')

commit_message:
Remove uwsgi http port and add var for buffer-size

We don't use the http port, since nginx connects directly to the socket
on 127.0.0.1. Additionally, this adds a variable to allow the
buffer-size value in the uwsgi configuration to be set.

Change-Id: Icb1e7df83aa8e77aa4e93af2048318898d8e22ee
(cherry picked from commit 91371452883ee4eba7011c96c705980a2e9ef917)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_nova refs/changes/03/436603/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: nova_wsgi_buffer_size: 65535

commit_message:
Add test case to test the reset action of libvirt watchdog

A watchdog device can be configured to automatically restart
an instance when the guest OS hangs/crashes. This test does the
following to check that this feature is working correctly:
1.) Boots an instance.
2.) Triggers the watchdog device.
3.) Checks whether the instance has been properly restarted.

This test depends on an image that has the necessary drivers.

Change-Id: Ib5be335e98a0aec5d1502f28d7e8e09fc1fa6ce1
Depends-On: Ia988db7abac50a8c674bc4c4ee0cfce5e303becb

commit_message:
Implementation Neutron SR-IOV

This change adds the new attribute
``sriov_host_interface`` in order to map ml2 network
names to physical SR-IOV capable network interfaces.

Co-Authored-By: James Denton <james.denton@rackspace.com>

Change-Id: Ia62725e2369f75000157e0ab2c3f858e61fef10d
Closes-Bug: #1653283
(cherry picked from commit ab176bbe0d1bd7ae247a7693e3d8134bc4cdd563)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-plugins refs/changes/21/436221/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - The new provider network attribute ``sriov_host_interfaces`` is added to support SR-IOV network mappings inside Neutron. The provider_network adds new items network_sriov_mappings and network_sriov_mappings_list to the provider_networks dictionary. Multiple interfaces can be defined by comma separation.

commit_message:
[07/xx] Replace process_object with controller.update/delete

This patch breaks the process_object logic into update and delete parts
and moves it into local controller.
We perform checks on actions before all calls to process_object so we
can just replace the code with the correct action. This also helps to
hide to the different treatment of new and old style models.

Partially-Implements: blueprint refactor-nb-api
Change-Id: I45e2cccfb4279f1fd6468057ea80f2129a7da05b

commit_message:
Split out Keystone upgrade into it's own script

This will separate out the runs so that varaibles and modules are not
re-used across runs - ensuring the latest modules and versions are used,
and ensuring multiple versions of the tests playbook aren't required on
non-upgrade runs.

Change-Id: Iacaf5919a468cf267418718fdac5c270674a3454

commit_message:
Items to consider for PhazrIO and dynamic metadata changes

- Drop set_decode_data_offset which is unused (always 0) currently
- Make encode_offset as functional to be more generic
- Add generic *return zero* functions instead of defining them in all
  backends
Change-Id: Iaf55251292df06b263a4c82728d6edbb65ba5dbe

commit_message:
Deprecate (and slate for removal) UUID tokens

Deprecate UUID token provider. With fernet tokens being made the
default, the UUID tokens are much like PKI tokens, an aging relic
of Keystone-Times-Past. Keystone is consolidating token issuance
and validation to the most effective form.

This also deprecates the following:

* token-bind capabilities, as that is a feature that was at best
  partially implemented in UUID and PKI tokens, with explicit
  non-support in Fernet.

* token-persistence driver and explicit token persistence code.

Change-Id: I724169a49ce12d8dd514471c34ac2b752eb98c8a
bp: deprecated-as-of-pike
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/88/428388/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- deprecations: - | * UUID token provider ``[token] provider=uuid`` has been deprecated in favor of Fernet tokens ``[token] provider=fernet``. With Fernet tokens becoming the default UUID tokens can be slated for removal in the R release. This also deprecates token-bind support as it was never implemented for fernet.

commit_message:
Use base.create_flavor in servers test

This is to replace the multi-lines of creating flavor with
one call to base.create_flavor, so the code will look simpler.

Besides, _get_unused_flavor_id in ServersAdminNegativeTestJSON is not
necessary, for the random flavor id can hardly duplicate with the
existing ones.

Change-Id: I752b71860560a1a6c9368d07578a09b964859067

commit_message:
ensure OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_URL is always configured

This is being moved in the template file such that it will ensure the
variable is always rendered. This change is needed for multi-region
clouds.

Change-Id: Ib3fa401e6ecf4053ef0a4a5bb9d18ae18ae7f07a
Closes-Bug: #1660344
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Not to skip schedulers when live migration is invoked from Horizon
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-24 14:33:40.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/api.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/8b05e57ff80411d3b3cc3fa12df1a6b39ea1bc47', 'message': 'Not to skip schedulers when live migration is invoked from Horizon

When calling live migration from Horizon, nova-api gets force=None, then
schedulers are skipped consequently. Note that live migration from CLI
passes force=False by contrast. This fix ensures to call schedulers even
when force=None.

Change-Id: I5a1de7ca90e76f248f7306518967282168e127c1
'}]
commit_message:
Not to skip schedulers when live migration is invoked from Horizon

When calling live migration from Horizon, nova-api gets force=None, then
schedulers are skipped consequently. Note that live migration from CLI
passes force=False by contrast. This fix ensures to call schedulers even
when force=None.

Change-Id: I5a1de7ca90e76f248f7306518967282168e127c1

commit_message:
Implement tag filter strategy

Renames the "artifacting" strategy to "tagfilter" and implements
a more generic tag skipping implementation that can be defined
from within the ansible vars structure dynamically on a per-host,
per-group, or per-playbook basis.

To use the tagfilter strategy, run the playbook with
strategy: tagfilter

and define a hostvar named "skip_tags". Skip tags can be a string
or a list, and any tag CONTAINING a skip tag (an exact match is not
needed) will be skipped.

Also added is a check for a var called "skip_handlers", defaulted
to True. When skip_handlers is enabled, no handlers will be run
regardless of whether the task is skipped or not. If set to False,
handlers will be allowed to run as normal except when tasks are
skipped by the skip_tags.

Change-Id: I649707e6744e03763c4e786d203716ebf657ab48
(cherry picked from commit 5d6c040d189dad64a3e8a95f5aabdb146ce19d65)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-plugins refs/changes/66/437966/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Implement tag filter strategy

Renames the "artifacting" strategy to "tagfilter" and implements
a more generic tag skipping implementation that can be defined
from within the ansible vars structure dynamically on a per-host,
per-group, or per-playbook basis.

To use the tagfilter strategy, run the playbook with
strategy: tagfilter

and define a hostvar named "skip_tags". Skip tags can be a string
or a list, and any tag CONTAINING a skip tag (an exact match is not
needed) will be skipped.

Also added is a check for a var called "skip_handlers", defaulted
to True. When skip_handlers is enabled, no handlers will be run
regardless of whether the task is skipped or not. If set to False,
handlers will be allowed to run as normal except when tasks are
skipped by the skip_tags.

Change-Id: I649707e6744e03763c4e786d203716ebf657ab48
(cherry picked from commit 5d6c040d189dad64a3e8a95f5aabdb146ce19d65)

commit_message:
Run cell enrollment after ceph_client

This will re-execute the nova role with a limited task execution
that will initialize ceph hypervisors to their cell.

Change-Id: Iaa11b1cf5bbeb816253c2a9942af053749d0eb1c
Parital-Bug: #1662241
Depends-On: Idc3237f98c110beed942107f2e8a1630c26f6d79

commit_message:
Conditional task execution using grouping

Adds a nova_taskset list which can be used to filter task execution
in the role if needed. This can be used in upstream playbooks to
ie. when ceph_client is run to link the rbd lib into nova, the
os_nova role can be re-run with nova_taskset: ['cell_enrollment']
to cause population of the compute host's cell.

Change-Id: Idc3237f98c110beed942107f2e8a1630c26f6d79
Partial-Bug: #1662241
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_nova refs/changes/79/429779/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Task set to run. All supported task sets are enabled by default. # By running the role with limited elements in this list, the role's functions # can be filtered/conditionally run. nova_taskset: - install - configure - cell_enrollment

commit_message:
Containers: workaround for neutron DB sync

Neutron DB sync didn't have permission to read the config files, we now
run neutron-db-manage as root until we can find a more permanent
solution.

Change-Id: I502a8514adc523c7cac1da059be10480eef71cb9
Closes-Bug: #1667300

commit_message:
Implement tag filter strategy

Renames the "artifacting" strategy to "tagfilter" and implements
a more generic tag skipping implementation that can be defined
from within the ansible vars structure dynamically on a per-host,
per-group, or per-playbook basis.

To use the tagfilter strategy, run the playbook with
strategy: tagfilter

and define a hostvar named "skip_tags". Skip tags can be a string
or a list, and any tag CONTAINING a skip tag (an exact match is not
needed) will be skipped.

Also added is a check for a var called "skip_handlers", defaulted
to True. When skip_handlers is enabled, no handlers will be run
regardless of whether the task is skipped or not. If set to False,
handlers will be allowed to run as normal except when tasks are
skipped by the skip_tags.

Change-Id: I649707e6744e03763c4e786d203716ebf657ab48

commit_message:
Fix downloading of pre-created leap release venvs

Precreated bundled venvs for OpenStack-Ansible have been created,
update the default VENV_URL with the path to them. Also fix the wget
command used to download them so that it returns a 0 on success and
deletes a failed download allowing the local build function to continue
on.

Change-Id: Ic4ae115384015dd7159da4e5850452bb5db181be

commit_message:
Add profiling support to neutronclient

To be able to create profiling traces for Neutron, client should be
able to send special HTTP header that contains trace info.
This patch is also important to be able to make cross project
traces. (Typical case nova calls neutron via python client, if
profiler is initialized in nova, neutron client will add extra
header, that will be parsed by special osprofiler middleware in neutron
api.)

Closes-Bug: #1335640

Co-Authored-By: Roman Podoliaka <rpodolyaka@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: Ic11796889075b2a0e589b70398fc4d4ed6f3ef7c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient refs/changes/08/281508/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_utils import importutilsosprofiler_profiler = importutils.try_import("osprofiler.profiler") if osprofiler_profiler: parser.add_argument('--profile', metavar='HMAC_KEY', help='HMAC key to use for encrypting context ' 'data for performance profiling of operation. ' 'This key should be the value of the HMAC key ' 'configured for the OSprofiler middleware in ' 'nova; it is specified in the Nova ' 'configuration file at /etc/nova/nova.conf ' 'Without the key, profiling will not be ' 'triggered even if OSprofiler is enabled on ' 'the server side.') profile = osprofiler_profiler and self.options.profile if profile: osprofiler_profiler.init(self.options.profile) return self.run_subcommand(remainder), profile res = NeutronShell(NEUTRON_API_VERSION).run( if res[1]: trace_id = osprofiler_profiler.get().get_base_id() print(_("Trace ID: %s") % trace_id) print(_("To display trace use next command:\n" "osprofiler trace show --html %s ") % trace_id) return res[0]

commit_message:
rehome agent ovsdb api + native commands

The neutron agent ovsdb api and native modules are used
by a number of consumers including networking-ovn. This
patch rehomes them to neutron-lib.

The following refactorings are noteworthy:
- The functions in helpers.py are only used in idlutils, so they
are move there.
- A few constants were moved out of the conf files and put
into neutron_lib.agent.constants as they make more sense
there.

Also note that while there's a current neutron patch related to
these opts in neutron [1] if we agree to this neutron-lib opts
approach the respective changes from [1] will change when
we consume this from neutron-lib.

TODOs before merging this patch:
- Determine if this rehome make sense.
- UTs.
- More manual testing.
- Docs (if there are any to rehome in neutron).
- Release note

[1] https://review.openstack.org/347867/

Change-Id: Ifed84fefa236c32a0c1986910423e69f47a5367f

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo_config import cfg from neutron_lib.agent.ovsdb import api as ovsdb cfg.CONF.import_opt('ovs_vsctl_timeout', 'neutron.agent.common.ovs_lib') def _connection_to_manager_uri(conn_uri): proto, addr = conn_uri.split(':', 1) if ':' in addr: ip, port = addr.split(':', 1) return 'p%s:%s:%s' % (proto, port, ip) else: return 'p%s:%s' % (proto, addr) def enable_connection_uri(conn_uri): class OvsdbVsctlContext(object): vsctl_timeout = cfg.CONF.ovs_vsctl_timeout manager_uri = _connection_to_manager_uri(conn_uri) api = ovsdb.API.get(OvsdbVsctlContext, 'vsctl') api.add_manager(manager_uri).execute(check_error=False, log_errors=True)

commit_message:
Move swift upgrades into its own shell script

The upgrade path becomes complicated as previous variables are stored
and we have to start a clean run.

The best way to achieve this is to separate the run steps out in a shell
script for upgrades only.

Change-Id: Ib2d2c8bad5241779d52cdc9428d7057c770d2d7c
(cherry picked from commit 44cdfed99de629d6ba6df0d5abbc83ead7d7fd9e)

commit_message:
Reload nginx instead of restart

We don't need to restart nginx - we can instead just reload the
service. Additionally, as more services move to use nginx frontend, it
would be bad to restart all NGinx services at the same time.

For now we need to investigate the impact of reloads in UWsgi before
moving over to a "reload" on UWsgi.

Change-Id: I60e370e784a1ff3a0f5bf8551be804bf05d8bb43

commit_message:
Stable StackDefinition API for template plugins

Change-Id: I362eb9774053c1bbef79b94bce7a96329462ef36
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-specs refs/changes/59/424359/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode .. This template should be in ReSTructured text. The filename in the git repository should match the launchpad URL, for example a URL of https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/awesome-thing should be named awesome-thing.rst . Please do not delete any of the sections in this template. If you have nothing to say for a whole section, just write: None For help with syntax, see http://sphinx-doc.org/rest.html To test out your formatting, see http://www.tele3.cz/jbar/rest/rest.html ===================== StackDefinition class ===================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/stack-definition Encapsulate all data about the definition of the stack - including the template, parameter values, resource attributes & reference IDs - in a class and use that in intrinsic functions instead of the Stack object itself. Problem description =================== A number of problems arise from the fact the we pass the heat.engine.stack.Stack object representing the stack to Template.parse() (and thence to the Function objects) in order to provide access to data needed to define the stack. The main issue is that the so-called 'lightweight stack', used in convergence when performing a check on a single resource, is not particularly lightweight. In particular, in order for the resource being checked to use an attribute or resource ID from another resource we create a heat.engine.resource.Resource object for every resource in the stack. This occurs even though the actual values we need are passed in over RPC and none of the Resource object's data is actually loaded from the database, nor any of its code used. Eliminating loading the data from the database reduced memory use by 10%, and further savings are likely from not creating O(n^2) Resource objects in the course of a graph traversal. In addition, using the Stack object in this way makes it extremely unclear what part of the interface is stable for the purposes of third-party Template plugins and their associated Functions. Developers don't know which aspects of the Stack interface they need to preserve across versions, and plugin developers don't know what they can rely on. Many of the potential operations that the Stack class makes possible may, in fact, be horrifically inefficient in the convergence architecture, or may become so in future. Proposed change =============== Create a new StackDefinition class that encapsulates the data needed to define the stack. Pass this object to Template.parse() in place of the Stack object. When a resource is accessed via the StackDefinition, return a ResourceProxy object that contains the pertinent data only. For all intents and purposes, the initial API will comprise whatever parts of the Stack and Resource classes that are currently used by intrinsic functions in the HOT or Cfn Template plugins. Existing interfaces will be maintained, so that no code changes are required for any plugins using this subset of the functionality. This includes: - Template - Environment - Parameter values - Resources - Name - Status - Action - Attributes - Reference ID - DB ID - UUID - Parent (facade) resource - Metadata - Template In convergence when checking a resource, only those other resources on which there is a direct dependency will have a proxy available, and only attributes required by the current resource (as returned by the function.dep_attrs() function) will have values available. Unless mentioned specifically above, no other data will be available from the StackDefinition. This will potentially break third-party Template plugins, but it is impossible to know to what extent this is a problem due to the undefined surface area of the current stable API. However, anything relying on behaviour outside of the proposed API is quite possibly highly inefficient, and completely untested in upstream Heat. On balance, it's worth tolerating this breakage, early in a development cycle, in order to move to a guaranteed stable API. Third-party Template plugin developers have the opportunity to weigh in on this spec with requests. Future changes to the API (beyond Pike) will require a deprecation period. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: zaneb Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: pike-1 Work Items ---------- - Encapsulate in a NodeData class the data that convergence records about a node in the graph after traversing it. - Teach Resource to generate its own NodeData. - Create a ParentResourceProxy to encapsulate data about the facade resource and potentially load it independently of the parent stack. - Move the Stack's template and other data into a StackDefinition class and proxy any requests for that data to it. - Update the NodeData after processing each Resource in the legacy path. - Pass the StackDefinition in place of the Stack to Template.parse(). Dependencies ============ None

commit_message:
Fix MFA rule checks for LDAP auth

LDAP authentication was broken by the addition of MFA rule checking.
This patch fixes that.

Change-Id: I4efe4b1b90c93110509cd599f9dd047c313dade3
Closes-Bug: #1662762

commit_message:
Policy in code (Part 2)

This commit moves domain, groups and projects to the correct module to
implement policy in code.

Future patches will move the remaining rule groups from policy.json
into their respective files.

Change-Id: I18d6290a820f7d067511d9d79ab77bc5a3181407
Partially-Implements: bp policy-in-code

commit_message:
Add spec for cinder volume backup resource

Change-Id: I3de3b2f31cc2118fe02b1a68b3e77a1816942fd8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-specs refs/changes/27/196327/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================ Cinder volume backup support ============================ https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/volume-backup-resource Add support for Cinder volume backup resources in Heat. Problem description =================== Cinder provide backup feature to backup a volume (usually for production use) to backup storage. The backup is related with original volume but they can have different lifesycle. Though Heat support creating a volume from backup (as restore), Heat does not support the backup creation. Proposed change =============== Add Cinder volume backup support and implement following resource types: 1. OS::Cinder::VolumeBackup Properties: * availability_zone (optional) * size (optional) * volume_id (required) * name (optional) * description (optional) * container (optional) * metadata (map, optional) Attributes: * availability_zone * size * volume_id * name * description * container * metadata This resource needs following actions: * create * delete Alternatives ------------ None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: wuyicang Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: Liberty-2 Work Items ---------- * Add Cinder volume backup resource Dependencies ============ None

commit_message:
Handle log message interpolation by the logger in cluster/

According to OpenStack Guideline[1], logged string message should be
interpolated by the logger.

[1]: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#adding-variables-to-log-messages

Change-Id: Id67c1599d7921247521d4b9e65222a670220a801
Related-Bug: #1642552

commit_message:
Policy in Code (part 1)

This adds the basic framework for registering and using default policy
rules in code. Rules should be defined and returned from a module in
keystone/policies, and then added to the list in
keystone/policies/__init__.py.

This commit does the following:
    - Introduces framework for registering default policies in code
    - Moves default endpoint policies into code
    - Moves default service policies into code
    - Moves default region policies into code

Future patches will move the remaining rule groups from policy.json
into their respective files.

Partially-Implements: bp policy-in-code
Change-Id: I27215570477e3c1e6166949ea51f20801ff854cf

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo_policy import policy rules = [ policy.RuleDefault('admin_required', 'role:admin or is_admin:1'), policy.RuleDefault('service_role', 'role:service') policy.RuleDefault('service_or_admin', 'rule:admin_required or rule:service_role') policy.RuleDefault('owner', 'user_id:%(user_id)s') policy.RuleDefault('admin_or_owner', 'rule:admin_required or rule:owner') policy.RuleDefault('token_subject', 'user_id:%(target.token.user_id)s') policy.RuleDefault('admin_or_token_subject', 'rule:admin_required or rule:token_subject') policy.RuleDefault('service_admin_or_token_subject', 'rule:service_or_admin or rule:token_subject') ] def list_rules(): return rules

subject: SolidFire: Handle connect_volume() failure when create vol from image
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-17 20:04:00.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/solidfire.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/a73e37aff57d3b0d1e10c9a8a494b64f052886b0', 'message': "SolidFire: Handle connect_volume() failure when create vol from image

Currently the _create_image_volume() method in solidfire.py doesn't
catch the exception for initialize_connection() or connect_volume(),
therefore when something wrong happens at this stage, which is as
critial as image conversion, the empty volume created as image cache
wouldn't be deleted.  And that invalid image cache would cause all
consecutive volume creation from same image fail silently.

This change makes simple adjustment of the code to make sure the
errors happen at connecting volume to controler stage is being
covered.

Change-Id: Idd192be86a83dc341431593ab27bed9178cc36d1
Closes-bug: #1663782
(cherry picked from commit 55c1863e1dcd834f491085365e774d017c147448)
"}]
commit_message:
SolidFire: Handle connect_volume() failure when create vol from image

Currently the _create_image_volume() method in solidfire.py doesn't
catch the exception for initialize_connection() or connect_volume(),
therefore when something wrong happens at this stage, which is as
critial as image conversion, the empty volume created as image cache
wouldn't be deleted.  And that invalid image cache would cause all
consecutive volume creation from same image fail silently.

This change makes simple adjustment of the code to make sure the
errors happen at connecting volume to controler stage is being
covered.

Change-Id: Idd192be86a83dc341431593ab27bed9178cc36d1
Closes-bug: #1663782
(cherry picked from commit 55c1863e1dcd834f491085365e774d017c147448)

commit_message:
Prepare local.conf for functional and fullstack jobs

Since those jobs are not deployed by devstack-gate, we need to dump the
contents of local.conf file stored in DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG ourselves
before calling to ./stack.sh.

Change-Id: I23b204856e3bd520e70e3b5326240ab75e5f13df

commit_message:
Reduced the complexity of the SingleColumnValueFilter method

The McCabe's cyclomatic complexity of the SingleColumnValueFilter is
very large - 21
(results: http://openqa.sed.hu/dashboard)

I extracted some of the functionalities into helper functions
to reduce the complexity of method.
Additionally it became more readable as well, without
changing its functionality.

Change-Id: Ib4097596ebf5803d6ed15e7645878ae0e111a2fa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/08/437308/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import operator ops = {"=": operator.eq, "<": operator.lt, "<=": operator.le, ">": operator.gt, ">=": operator.ge, "!=": operator.ne} def _operators_(ops, op, r, data, column, value, row): if ((op in ops) and (column in data) and (ops[op](data[column], value))): r[row] = data _operators_(ops, op, r, data, column, value, row)
deleted_lines: if op == '=': if column in data and data[column] == value: r[row] = data elif op == '<': if column in data and data[column] < value: r[row] = data elif op == '<=': if column in data and data[column] <= value: r[row] = data elif op == '>': if column in data and data[column] > value: r[row] = data elif op == '>=': if column in data and data[column] >= value: r[row] = data elif op == '!=': if column in data and data[column] != value: r[row] = data

Grenade: don't enable tempest plugins in settings

Tempest plugin is enabled in infra configuration with appropriate
branch, so just remove tempest enable.

commit_message:
Fix tests for bug 1656183

Changes expected success code for the delete-namespace-tags
function in the NamespaceTagsClient class, which is modified
in Glance by I4b6dc1714aeca409a85bfa1f9b729147da704df8

This function is called by MetadataNamespaceTagsTest, both by a
delete-namespace-tags test and as part of resource cleanup.

Change accepts either the 200 (incorrect) or 204 (correct)
success code, allowing tempest containing this change to be
used against older versions of Glance.

Change-Id: I84626976ca729f65b0ee0ea6afe5c9a6a408eecc

commit_message:
Make python3 rally job voting in Neutron

This makes the python3 rally job voting in Neutron and alters
the python2 job to only run on the stable branches.

Note that this job is not in the gate queue even though it is
voting. This is the way the current rally job that it is replacing
is configured.

Change-Id: Ib478da40a5df8f4060f61d251570957fbc363a6a

commit_message:
Add cookie tracking to OVS firewall driver

Added unique cookie to OVS firewall driver flows,
to allow better flow tracking.

Modified port deletion during port binding. Now deleted
flows are filtered by in_port and cookie; only flows
with cookie not present in reserved ones or matching the
cookie used by OVS agent will be deleted.

Change-Id: Iecf9af21cf389c98db7f73379ccd05da18da44e9
Closes-Bug: #1559920

subject: Fix the deletePlan action
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-24 11:52:27.000000000', 'files': ['src/js/actions/PlansActions.js'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ui/commit/02609106c1e51674adcabe1fa4ac48b6467be0be', 'message': "Fix the deletePlan action

In case of failure of plan deletion, a non-existant function
(planDeleted) was called. This was due to a previous refactor
which renamed the function but didn't fix the invocations.
This patch fixes the issue so that the correct function
(deletePlanFailed) is now called.

Change-Id: I12fcfd6f94b90378055cabc3a65ecb3f012f6f91
"}]
commit_message:
Fix the deletePlan action

In case of failure of plan deletion, a non-existant function
(planDeleted) was called. This was due to a previous refactor
which renamed the function but didn't fix the invocations.
This patch fixes the issue so that the correct function
(deletePlanFailed) is now called.

Change-Id: I12fcfd6f94b90378055cabc3a65ecb3f012f6f91
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ui refs/changes/79/437879/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: dispatch(this.deletePlanFailed(planName));

commit_message:
use local_conf for one of the tempest tests

This changes one of the tempest experimental jobs to using the new
local_conf stanza instead of inline DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG. It's on
experimental so it should be safe to merge and iterate on to work out
any bugs in the system.

Change-Id: Id0ce3f617790fd1822f08b293cfeabfa22bf9ab6

commit_message:
convert dvr-ovs-native job to local_conf stanza

This is one of the projects that used an inline pre_test_hook to set
local.conf. Move it over to the new stanza to test this all works. The
only use of this in the gate is non voting, so we should be able to
land and iterate to make sure that this is really working.

Change-Id: I64f610e963192be48166e8ef638fee85075dcae0

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-20 18:03:33.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/base/horizon.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/f8313f755c56b2cf614605588f8164c510b18956', 'message': "Replace default to be more robust

Specifying undef as the fallback only works because the merge
function specifically checks for this:
next if arg.is_a? String and arg.empty? # empty string is synonym for puppet's undef

But the empty Hash would be a much more robust default.

Change-Id: I7e302c00ef030d75998e352d88b3ccc60b194ab7
"}]
commit_message:
Replace default to be more robust

Specifying undef as the fallback only works because the merge
function specifically checks for this:
next if arg.is_a? String and arg.empty? # empty string is synonym for puppet's undef

But the empty Hash would be a much more robust default.

Change-Id: I7e302c00ef030d75998e352d88b3ccc60b194ab7

commit_message:
Handle log message interpolation by the logger in backup/

According to OpenStack Guideline[1], logged string message should be
interpolated by the logger.

[1]: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#adding-variables-to-log-messages

Change-Id: Ia79addd292000dfd1e3ecb15884b8dccac4d9284
Related-Bug: #1642552

commit_message:
chill out on the number of items in toc

we have an absurd amount of entries in our table of contents[1]. this
patch does better groupings so we nest a bit more.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/project-install-guide/telemetry/draft/

Change-Id: Ib56af520483b39e2c80ce03e0cf48a18bbfa5267
(cherry picked from commit b01c33f78b1e441d70e19c0b793c670c0f945b3e)

Add detail around drop of use-embedded-webserver

The ceph-radosgw has dropped this option; ensure this
is covered in the release notes.

Change-Id: I892737b7041c4c1727bb8196061e4b8d6e83fb38

commit_message:
the role resource should not have put_create=True

according to the api docs [1], the role create operation is an HTTP
POST request

[1] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/identity/v3/#create-role

Change-Id: I0f6efe51abf15b298ce90d41f2071edd9c1211b6

commit_message:
pip_install: fix installation from directory

This change makes clearer the difference between a pypi and local
package installation

It adds support of extra for package installed from path.

Closes-bug: #1647561
Change-Id: I4584717b84f8d54964465e5f5cb224ae5534e95d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/77/407377/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # pip_install package [package\[extra\] ...] # pip_install directory # pip_install directory\[extra1,extra2\] local package_dir if [[ $# -eq 1 ]]; then # We perhaps install a package from a directory, so we set package_dir # to install python3 version if required and the test-requirements.txt local package_dir_guess=${!#} local package_dir_guess_without_extra=${package_dir_guess%\[*} if [[ -d "$package_dir_guess}" ]]; then package_dir=$package_dir_guess elif [[ -d "$package_dir_guess_without_extra}" ]]; then package_dir=$package_dir_guess_without_extra fi fi if [[ -n "$package_dir" ]]; then local test_req="${package_dir}/test-requirements.txt" if [[ $result == 0 ]] && [[ -n "$package_dir" ]] && [[ -e "$test_req" ]]; then
deleted_lines: # pip_install package [package ...] local package_dir=${!#} if [[ -d "$package_dir" ]]; then local test_req="${!#}/test-requirements.txt" if [[ $result == 0 ]] && [[ -e "$test_req" ]]; then

commit_message:
Use them same versions of Influx or Cassandra

Versions of Influx or Cassandra between tox and devstack
env were different. Now in both places OpenStack requirements
are used.

Additionally:
- moved Influx and Cassandra to test-requirements.

Change-Id: I5be1be023b605a0b7efe718796877b90f9dc06f0
Related-Bug: #1628719

commit_message:
Update instructions to point to RHEL 7.3 guest image (not 7.1)

This minor update includes instructions for downloading the correct
version of the RHEL guest image when building TripleO images. The
older RHEL 7.1 image will not work correctly with the latest builds.

Change-Id: Ibc1b169970f891c2934f4488162c4f181bea97b0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-docs refs/changes/18/435118/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Download the RHEL 7.3 cloud image or copy it over from a different location, for example: ``https://access.redhat.com/downloads/content/69/ver=/rhel---7/7.3/x86_64/product-downloads``, and define the needed environment variables for RHEL 7.3 prior to running export DIB_LOCAL_IMAGE=rhel-guest-image-7.3-35.x86_64.qcow2
deleted_lines: Download the RHEL 7.1 cloud image or copy it over from a different location, for example: ``https://access.redhat.com/downloads/content/69/ver=/rhel---7/7.1/x86_64/product-downloads``, and define the needed environment variables for RHEL 7.1 prior to running export DIB_LOCAL_IMAGE=rhel-guest-image-7.1-20150224.0.x86_64.qcow2

commit_message:
add tripleo non-voting job into tacker gate

With the motivation of adding more diversity in how do we test
tacker, this patch will add a tripleo job, non-voting.

The idea is to bring more feedback when testing patches in these
projects and detect what failures we could have outside devstack.

The jobs are not voting. We don't expect tacker team to open TripleO job
logs. The idea is to let TripleO folks know when a job is red so they
can investigate and tell if something critical is broken in the patch.

Change-Id: If2639be47e61649a220324e32d91dd9690a4f7e9

commit_message:
Add periodic networking-calico Tempest DSVM job

This is to catch if changes in Neutron core or neutron-lib cause the
networking-calico to become incorrect (and so need updating).

Change-Id: Ieeb5a19f4f579c34ea6cc0fa94c56df6beb37481

Add pep8 job for vmware-vspc

We cannot use the 'python-jobs' template to run pep8 because the
project is Python3 only. Hence adding a pep8 job separately.

commit_message:
Fix missing integrated gate jobs on swift

When all the changes around xenial and neutron by default were done,
the swift project was lost because it wasn't using the integrated gate
alias. That now expresses the set of jobs that swift was running, so
we can use that again.

Change-Id: I6b2a23f384cc6976c1aa4edcd21ca02f7c3ea35b

Change repo url for cloudkitty

'https://github.com/stackforge/cloudkitty' is linked to
'https://github.com/openstack/cloudkitty', so use the
latter instead.

Same work is done for manila as well.
