commit_message:
Don't set external_network_bridge by default

Since the empty value is the default for the option, and when explcitly
set in config file, it triggers a deprecation warning for the option,
avoid setting it unless we actually need to override the new default
value.

Change-Id: If423114d7a52da29b97d1fb473a955d9d69a1a3e

commit_message:
DB code refactor, simplify and clean-up

* Centralized the common function is_image_visible
* Removed unused copy/paste version of is_image_mutable

Change-Id: I094ee44ef86f7e7eb2353f801d5aef77391c95ff

subject: worlddump: Use __future__ print_function
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-06 21:56:12.000000000', 'files': ['tools/worlddump.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/09949e0dc61d9ef420b1528d0549092f88bc422a', 'message': "worlddump: Use __future__ print_function

Commit e7361775c112e32ea517eddc344641897d273d25 changed the code to
use Python 3 style print function, but when doing 'print()' in Python
2.7 it would print '()':
    >>> print()
    ()

Import the __future__ print function so that a blank line will be
printed as expected. This will now work the same in Python 2 & 3.

Change-Id: I61742e107278f2327c18c9ab0de52d1914f16c97
"}]
commit_message:
worlddump: Use __future__ print_function

Commit e7361775c112e32ea517eddc344641897d273d25 changed the code to
use Python 3 style print function, but when doing 'print()' in Python
2.7 it would print '()':
    >>> print()
    ()

Import the __future__ print function so that a blank line will be
printed as expected. This will now work the same in Python 2 & 3.

Change-Id: I61742e107278f2327c18c9ab0de52d1914f16c97
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/99/429899/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from __future__ import print_function

commit_message:
Drop group key for charm bug tracking

All charms have now been moved to standalone LP projects, with
an associated 'openstack-charms' project group.

Drop the groups key as this was used to map bug tasks to the
Juju Charms Collection, which is no longer in use.

Change-Id: I409bb5b3540f18ed415a29d667be3274f3e4bc16

commit_message:
Abridge federated role assignment instructions

Now that horizon can handle federated users without memberships in projects[1]
we can condense the configuration section and make things simpler for the
reader by just having them create a new domain and not also a project.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/389337/

Change-Id: Ie1f4c888fbda709b32c3bd9c3ab73839879f026c

[Contributor] Update release task details

Update the release tasks with more detailed information
about the files that require updating for a release.

Change-Id: I785917ade9027dd8ac71e1ae03fccf226aba4f78
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/97/437197/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Update www pages ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ #. Create the docs.openstack.org index page for the new release, using the existing page as a template: - openstack-manuals/www/RELEASENAME/index.html #. Create the project-install-guide index pages for the new release, using the existing pages as templates: - openstack-manuals/www/project-install-guide/RELEASENAME/index.html - openstack-manuals/www/project-install-guide/RELEASENAME/obs-services.html - openstack-manuals/www/project-install-guide/RELEASENAME/rdo-services.html - openstack-manuals/www/project-install-guide/RELEASENAME/ubuntu-services.html #. Create the project-deploy-guide index for the new release, using the existing page as a template: - openstack-manuals/www/project-deploy-guide/RELEASENAME/index.html #. Add the new pages to the list in `openstack-manuals/www/www-index.html`. This patch should have a core -2 review on it until it is ready to be published. This should happen about a week before release day, sending the page live, but should remain unlinked until the last moment. This is to allow the release team to link to the new page. #. Update the dropdown menu. Merge this patch on release day: - openstack-manuals/www/templates/dropdown_releases_and_languages.tmpl #. Update the site redirects. Merge this patch on release day: - openstack-manuals/www/static/.htaccess #. Update the *Get started* links. Do not merge this patch until after the links are active: - openstack-manuals/doc/common/get-started-with-openstack.rstEvery book maintained by OpenStack Manuals must be checked for links referencing the old release. Do one patch per book, record the review number in the release etherpad so that release managers can review easily. For versioned books, these patches should have a core -2 review on them until they are ready to be published at release time. For continuously released books, these patches can be merged immediately.On release day, change the front page so the new release is the default by synchronising `openstack-manuals/www/RELEASENAME/index.html`, which you created earlier, with `openstack/openstack-manuals/www/index.html`. These two files should have the same content. Merge all the release day patches prepared earlier. Changes to the docs site can take an hour or more to populate, depending on the status of the gate and the number of changes being pushed at release time, so be prepared to have the release day patches ready well ahead of the official release time. You can check the current gate status at `Zuul status <http://status.openstack.org/zuul/>`_ to get an idea of the current merge times. Generate the site map ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ After the release day patches have merged, generate a new site map for docs.openstack.org using the ``sitemap`` script in the **openstack-doc-tools** repository. Copy the `sitemap.xml` file into the `www/static` directory in the **openstack-manuals** repository and commit the change.
deleted_lines: Publish index page ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Create a new index page for docs.openstack.org, at `openstack-manuals/www/RELEASENAME/index.html`, copying the existing page for the current release, with updated release name and date. Add the new page to the list in `openstack-manuals/www/www-index.html`. This patch should have a core -2 review on it until it is ready to be published. This should happen about a week before release day, sending the page live, but should remain unlinked until the last moment. This is to allow the release team to link to the new page.Every book maintained by OpenStack Manuals will need to be checked for links referencing the old release. Do one patch per book, record the review number in the release etherpad so that release managers can review easily. For versioned books, these patches should have a core -2 review on them until they are ready to be published at release time. For continuously released books, these patches can be merged immediately. Change the front page so the new release is the default, by synchronising `openstack-manuals/www/RELEASENAME/index.html`, which you created earlier, with `openstack/openstack-manuals/www/index.html`. These two files should have the same content. You will also need to update the release version in the dropdown header. This is the main patch that sends the release live, so it must have a core -2 review on it until it is ready to be published. Changes to the docs site can take an hour or more to populate, depending on the status of the gate and the number of changes being pushed at release time, so be prepared to have this ready well ahead of the official release time. You can check the current gate status at `Zuul status <http://status.openstack.org/zuul/>`_ to get an idea of the current merge times.

commit_message:
hyperv: make sure to plug OVS VIFs after resize/migrate

Since the network_info wasn't getting passed to vmops.power_on
after a resize/cold migrate confirmation, the OVS VIFs weren't
getting plugged.

Change-Id: Ia9b7dc11cd74ba896a7254c16a95b7a834a28475
Closes-Bug: #1657424
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/14/422314/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self._vmops.power_on(instance, network_info=network_info)

Apply neutron database migration

Apply neutron database migration procedure:

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/neutron/devref/upgrade.html#server-upgrade

Change-Id: Id03e6cdd822bb8bd3d70ae1a1f70ccd9aba830ff
Implements: blueprint apply-service-upgrade-procedure
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/40/407840/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Migrate database and exit if KOLLA_UPGRADE variable is set. This catches all cases # of the KOLLA_UPGRADE variable being set, including empty. if [[ "${!KOLLA_UPGRADE[@]}" ]]; then echo "Expanding databas" neutron-db-manage upgrade --expand echo "Contracting databas" neutron-db-manage upgrade --contract exit 0 fi

commit_message:
Removed neutron_plugin_configure_debug_command functions

Those are not called by devstack anymore. This cleanup also gets rid of
code that attempts to set external_network_bridge to an empty value,
which triggers a deprecation warning for the option since it's going to
be removed in a next Neutron release.

Change-Id: I5adcbab877b4e8742522de81b1a85acfc33160d7

commit_message:
Fix creating the sublocal.conf for ironic

During the rebasing we apparently missed ironic for the
sublocalrc. This fixes this with the localrc_set calls instead of
heredocs.

Change-Id: I85d63fadea49096f48406297ec07d2111e5dfe93
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/86/437586/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: localrc_set "$sub_localconf" "HOST_TOPOLOGY" "multinode" localrc_set "$sub_localconf" "HOST_TOPOLOGY_ROLE" "subnode" # NOTE(vsaienko) we assume for now that we using only 1 subnode, # each subnode should have different switch name (bridge) as it is used # by networking-generic-switch to uniquely identify switch. localrc_set "$sub_localconf" "IRONIC_VM_NETWORK_BRIDGE" "sub1brbm" localrc_set "$sub_localconf" "OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE" "sub1brbm" localrc_set "$sub_localconf" "ENABLE_TENANT_TUNNELS" "False" localrc_set "$sub_localconf" "IRONIC_KEY_FILE" "$BASE/new/.ssh/ironic_key" localrc_set "$localrc" "HOST_TOPOLOGY" "multinode" localrc_set "$localrc" "HOST_TOPOLOGY_ROLE" "primary" localrc_set "$localrc" "HOST_TOPOLOGY_SUBNODES" "$sub_nodes" localrc_set "$localrc" "IRONIC_KEY_FILE" "$BASE/new/.ssh/ironic_key" localrc_set "$localrc" "GENERIC_SWITCH_KEY_FILE" "$BASE/new/.ssh/ironic_key" localrc_set "$localrc" "ENABLE_TENANT_TUNNELS" "False"
deleted_lines: cat <<EOF >>"$sub_localrc" HOST_TOPOLOGY=multinode HOST_TOPOLOGY_ROLE=subnode # NOTE(vsaienko) we assume for now that we using only 1 subnode, # each subnode should have different switch name (bridge) as it is used # by networking-generic-switch to uniquely identify switch. IRONIC_VM_NETWORK_BRIDGE=sub1brbm OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE=sub1brbm ENABLE_TENANT_TUNNELS=False IRONIC_KEY_FILE="$BASE/new/.ssh/ironic_key" EOF cat <<EOF >>"$localrc" HOST_TOPOLOGY=multinode HOST_TOPOLOGY_ROLE=primary HOST_TOPOLOGY_SUBNODES="$sub_nodes" IRONIC_KEY_FILE="$BASE/new/.ssh/ironic_key" GENERIC_SWITCH_KEY_FILE="$BASE/new/.ssh/ironic_key" ENABLE_TENANT_TUNNELS=False EOF

commit_message:
Do not run cinder API V1 tests anymore by default

I think now is a good time to stop running Cinder V1 tests. It should
save quite some Infra resources and jobs should run faster too.

Also, remove some useless variables in lib/tempest.

Change-Id: I0edf1d88c136c3b910a5773690a603eeacb50266

commit_message:
Revert "Remove the skip_unless_config and skip_if_config decorators"

This reverts commit 5cc4373c6e5967063b0343ce9ea4d5da38639e71.

Change-Id: I6456304a9a155bcd3fdedef1615556b4ca0955cd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/12/436612/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import functoolsimport testtoolsdef skip_unless_config(*args): """Decorator to raise a skip if a config opt doesn't exist or is False :param str group: The first arg, the option group to check :param str name: The second arg, the option name to check :param str msg: Optional third arg, the skip msg to use if a skip is raised :raises testtools.TestCaseskipException: If the specified config option doesn't exist or it exists and evaluates to False """ def decorator(f): group = args[0] name = args[1] @functools.wraps(f) def wrapper(self, *func_args, **func_kwargs): if not hasattr(CONF, group): msg = "Config group %s doesn't exist" % group raise testtools.TestCase.skipException(msg) conf_group = getattr(CONF, group) if not hasattr(conf_group, name): msg = "Config option %s.%s doesn't exist" % (group, name) raise testtools.TestCase.skipException(msg) value = getattr(conf_group, name) if not value: if len(args) == 3: msg = args[2] else: msg = "Config option %s.%s is false" % (group, name) raise testtools.TestCase.skipException(msg) return f(self, *func_args, **func_kwargs) return wrapper return decorator def skip_if_config(*args): """Raise a skipException if a config exists and is True :param str group: The first arg, the option group to check :param str name: The second arg, the option name to check :param str msg: Optional third arg, the skip msg to use if a skip is raised :raises testtools.TestCase.skipException: If the specified config option exists and evaluates to True """ def decorator(f): group = args[0] name = args[1] @functools.wraps(f) def wrapper(self, *func_args, **func_kwargs): if hasattr(CONF, group): conf_group = getattr(CONF, group) if hasattr(conf_group, name): value = getattr(conf_group, name) if value: if len(args) == 3: msg = args[2] else: msg = "Config option %s.%s is false" % (group, name) raise testtools.TestCase.skipException(msg) return f(self, *func_args, **func_kwargs) return wrapper return decorator

commit_message:
Allow integer port in os_transport_url

Currently we only allow to use strings
as the data type for ports.

Due to this we need to cast the data type
in the puppet modules because from THT
this is configured as a Number.

This submission allow to use either string
or numbers for the port parameter in the
os_transport_url function.

Change-Id: I9e56f8e2de542b20fe9e6995506cff5bb435e220
Closes-Bug: #1664561

deleted_lines: * port - (string) port to connect to host += ":#{v['port']}" if v.include?('port') hosts = hosts.map{ |h| "#{h}:#{v['port']}" } if v.include?('port')

commit_message:
Replace ansible_user with ssh_user

ansible_user is currently used both as the builtin variable
and a regular variable. Since its value changes multiple times
over the course of a deployment, determining its value at any given
point in time can be difficult. In addition, overriding its value
in order to connect to the virthost with a different user has
unexpected results for the same reason.

ansible_user is therefore replaced  with ssh_user, which is never
modified from its default in common defaults, and can be safely
overridden by the user.

Change-Id: Id9bc7c2a3b11140508ef0911de317a4f1ece05dd

commit_message:
Support local_conf from project-config

This adds the support for merging in local_conf from project config
into local.conf files deployed in jobs.

Change-Id: I81616a5b381fe203aef47628b52371609db5e5eb

commit_message:
Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due
to the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5
is available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: I7ffa3e3886300407a9b0f4f3cf35b95ec5096e05

commit_message:
Remove get_router when handling floating IP

It is useless to get router when handling floating IP, because
'gw_port_id' is no longer needed for setting NAT addresses.

Change-Id: Ief7f0a6ee4be62e08a2b3677ea2650a5549c6d01
Closes-Bug: #1664842
Signed-off-by: Dong Jun <dongj@dtdream.com>

deleted_lines: # Elevating the context here, to pass this test case # OVNL3ExtrarouteTests.test_floatingip_association_on_unowned_ # router router = self.get_router(context.elevated(), router_id) update_fip['gw_port_id'] = router['gw_port_id'] router = self.get_router(context.elevated(), router_id) update_fip['gw_port_id'] = router['gw_port_id'] router = self.get_router(context.elevated(), previous_router_id) update_fip['gw_port_id'] = router['gw_port_id'] router = self.get_router(context.elevated(), new_router_id) update_fip['gw_port_id'] = router['gw_port_id']

subject: Probe tests fail, as requests checks for strings.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-23 20:13:40.000000000', 'files': ['test/probe/test_object_expirer.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/2e199be6048f37ba983b28c4ffff953b8a63594a', 'message': 'Probe tests fail, as requests checks for strings.

The requests library checks that the headers are either strings or
bytes. Currently, the two test_object_expirer tests fail with the
message:
InvalidHeader: Header value 1487879553 must be of type str
or bytes, not <type 'int'>

The header in question is "x-delete-at". The patch converts it to
a string, before making a Swift Client request.

Change-Id: I738697cb6b696f0e346345f75e0069048961f2ff
'}]
commit_message:
Probe tests fail, as requests checks for strings.

The requests library checks that the headers are either strings or
bytes. Currently, the two test_object_expirer tests fail with the
message:
InvalidHeader: Header value 1487879553 must be of type str
or bytes, not <type 'int'>

The header in question is "x-delete-at". The patch converts it to
a string, before making a Swift Client request.

Change-Id: I738697cb6b696f0e346345f75e0069048961f2ff
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/01/437601/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: put_object(headers={'X-Delete-At': str(delete_at), obj_brain.put_object({'X-Delete-At': str(delete_at)})

commit_message:
Change SafeConfigParser into ConfigParser

SafeConfigParser supports interpolation on top of ConfigParser
in Python 2, and SafeConfigParser is deprecated in Python 3.2.
Use ConfigParser directly instead.

Closes-Bug: #1618666
Change-Id: I115646053de986b2df4775fb94edc7e7548093ae
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/05/368405/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: CONFIG = configparser.ConfigParser()

commit_message:
Make swift gate on python3.5 rally job

This should make sure the project does not introduce regressions in
other projects' gates when breaking python3 compatibility.

commit_message:
Add Container to Zun resources

This adds OS::Zun::Container to the Zun resources

Change-Id: I2cacc40583dbe67399dfb3b7fe45af5a7d303fd6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/57/437557/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from heat.common.i18n import _ from heat.engine import clients from heat.engine import properties from heat.engine import resource from heat.engine import support class Container(resource.Resource): support_status = support.SupportStatus(version='2015.2') PROPERTIES = ( NAME, IMAGE, COMMAND, CPU, MEMORY, ENVIRONMENT, WORKDIR, LABEL, IMAGE_PULL_POLICY, RESTART_POLICY ) = ( 'name', 'image', 'command', 'cpu', 'memory', 'environment', 'workdir', 'label', 'image_pull_policy', 'restart_policy' ) properties_schema = { NAME: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _('Name'), ), IMAGE: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _('Image'), required=True ), COMMAND: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _('command'), ), CPU: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _('CPU'), ), MEMORY: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _('Memory'), ), ENVIRONMENT: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _('environment'), ), WORKDIR: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _('Workdir'), ), LABEL: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _('label'), ), IMAGE_PULL_POLICY: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _('image_pull_policy') ), RESTART_POLICY: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _('restart_policy'), ), } default_client_name = 'zun' entity = 'containers' def handle_create(self): args = { 'name': self.properties.get(self.NAME), 'image': self.properties.get(self.IMAGE), 'command': self.properties.get(self.COMMAND), 'cpu': self.properties.get(self.CPU), 'memory': self.properties.get(self.MEMORY), 'environment': self.properties.get(self.ENVIRONMENT), 'workdir': self.properties.get(self.WORKDIR), 'label': self.properties.get(self.LABEL), 'image_pull_policy': self.properties.get(self.IMAGE_PULL_POLICY), 'restart_policy': self.properties.get(self.RESTART_POLICY) } container = self.client().containers.create(**args) self.resource_id_set(container.uuid) return container.uuid def handle_delete(self): if not self.resource_id: return try: self.client().containers.delete(self.resource_id) except Exception as exc: self.client_plugin().ignore_not_found(exc) def resource_mapping(): return { 'OS::Zun::Container': Container } def available_resource_mapping(): if not clients.has_client('zun'): return {} return resource_mapping()

commit_message:
Revert "Using os-testr to get better report"

This reverts commit d7f2d4f23eba13eea6c314bf5fde34df7a4df912.

ostestr spews what is IMHO an unmanageable amount of mostly worthless data when running tests - at least one line per test, of which there are 6351 at last count. There doesn't seem to be an option to quiet it down, so just revert it.

Change-Id: I7b12dc249e3e7041ab6f0ef36b3e5f0b082aeb7d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/81/436181/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: python setup.py testr --slowest --testr-args='{posargs}'

commit_message:
Update the test removal procedure

Tests that target and API which does not provide a version discovery
mechanism, and which introduces backward incompatibilites cannot
live in Tempest due to its branchless nature.

With this commit I propose to extend the list of exceptions from
the standard removal procedure to include this group of tests.

Example: I84626976ca729f65b0ee0ea6afe5c9a6a408eecc

Change-Id: I209b0b3d470bd284949a77d9c266d78e7c5a5c13
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/61/437361/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #. The test targets and API which includes a non-discoverable, backward incompatible change in one of the releases supported by Tempest or in the current version under development. Such tests cannot live in Tempest because of the branchless nature of Tempest. If the version of the API is not discoverable, a test have no way to enforce the correct behavior, so it must be removed.

commit_message:
Fix dstat log file path for stackviz

This commit fixes dstat log file path for stackviz. stackviz has a
feature to illustrate a dstat graphs. However it doesn't work because
the dstat log path is wrong.

Change-Id: I510921cf926fe49065d03c161b0a9735bb772908

commit_message:
Corrected router gateway set command

While configuring the external network as the default
router gateway for IPV6 in lib/neutron_plugins/services/l3,
"router" keyword is missing in the command.

Corrected the command.

Change-Id: I055bea5137a841f709d4865ec9a43d6b53f8f4c9
Closes-Bug: 1660712

commit_message:
Redirect deployment guide subdirectories appropriately

Currently it is possible to access [1] and [2] which shows
a bare autoindex. This patch ensures that accessing these
URL's redrects to the current stable deployment guide
index.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/project-deploy-guide/
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/project-deploy-guide/openstack-ansible/

Change-Id: Ib7a0e14283601b5c36e14ab298b5c6df948ec0c0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/05/437105/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Redirect any deploy guide project directory back to the current stable index redirectmatch 301 "^/project-deploy-guide/$" /project-deploy-guide/ocata/ redirectmatch 301 "^/project-deploy-guide/.*/$" /project-deploy-guide/ocata/

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-23 21:46:06.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/tests/unit/identity/v2/test_proxy.py', 'openstack/identity/v2/_proxy.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk/commit/951d4e29d3a3675a6cb472d5b4c4836f6d0b8e20', 'message': 'keystone api v2.0 does not paginate roles or users

when attempting to enumerate users or roles with against a v2.0
keystone api, openstacksdk gets stuck in a loop because it is
attempting to use pagination, but the server does not support
pagination for anything other than tenants.  From #keystone:

  2017-02-23 16:13 <breton> larsks: only tenants were supposed to
    be paginated in v2.0. Other things afaik no.

Change-Id: Id10f603d3e74dbb1821c016eaf648b5cc531de5a
'}]
commit_message:
keystone api v2.0 does not paginate roles or users

when attempting to enumerate users or roles with against a v2.0
keystone api, openstacksdk gets stuck in a loop because it is
attempting to use pagination, but the server does not support
pagination for anything other than tenants.  From #keystone:

  2017-02-23 16:13 <breton> larsks: only tenants were supposed to
    be paginated in v2.0. Other things afaik no.

Change-Id: Id10f603d3e74dbb1821c016eaf648b5cc531de5a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/91/437691/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return self._list(_role.Role, paginated=False, **query) return self._list(_user.User, paginated=False, **query)
deleted_lines: return self._list(_role.Role, paginated=True, **query) return self._list(_user.User, paginated=True, **query)

commit_message:
Remove the redundant command when deployment

when we copy the Kolla configuration files to /etc,
just copy the etc/kolla to /etc is ok (against with line 317).
remove the redundant command when deployment in "quickstart.rst"

Change-Id: Ifb0aeb9dd495c8a0d1275ec1cb8c4087c9bfac12
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/08/371608/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: Copy the Kolla configuration files to ``/etc``: :: # CentOS 7 cp -r /usr/share/kolla/etc_examples/kolla /etc/ # Ubuntu cp -r /usr/local/share/kolla/etc_examples/kolla /etc/

commit_message:
Extend monasca-log-api spec

Rename package from python-monasca-log-api to
openstack-monasca-log-api. Core Python monasca-log-api
is right now as a subpackage.

Also:
* Add configuration and service
files.
* Add creating configuration and log folders plus
assigning user and group.

Change-Id: Iff1983fa7d0495ba71753fb3b138ffb73abb4839
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rpm-packaging refs/changes/33/436433/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2017 Fujitsu LIMITED # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. %define component monasca-log-api %define os_pkg openstack-%{component} %define p_pkg python-%{component} %define username monasca-log-api %define groupname monasca-log-api %define log_api_conf_dir %{_sysconfdir}/%{name} %define log_api_log_dir /var/log/%{name} %define log_api_conf %{component}.conf %define log_api_logging %{component}-logging.conf Name: %{os_pkg}Source0: https://pypi.io/packages/source/m/%{component}/%{component}-%{version}.tar.gz Source1: %{log_api_conf} Source2: %{log_api_logging} Requires: %{p_pkg} = %{version} BuildArch: noarch %description monasca-log-api is a RESTful API server receiving logs from the deployed log agents. %package -n %{p_pkg} Summary: OpenStack Monasca Log Api plugin Group: Development/Languages/Python %description -n %{p-pkg}%autosetup -n %{component}-%{version}mv %{buildroot}%{_prefix}%{_sysconfdir} %{buildroot}%{_sysconfdir}/%{component}%pre %openstack_pre_user_group_create %{username} %{groupname} %service_add_pre %{name}.service %post %service_add_post %{name}.service %preun %service_del_preun %{name}.service %postun %service_del_postun %{name}.service if [ $1 -eq 0 ] ; then getent passwd %{username} > /dev/null if [ "$?" == "0" ] ; then userdel %{username} fi fi %{_sysconfdir}/%{component}
deleted_lines: %global sname monasca-log-api Name: {{ py2name('monasca-log-api') }}Source0: https://pypi.io/packages/source/m/%{sname}/%{sname}-%{version}.tar.gzRequires: {{ py2pkg('oslotest') }} Requires: {{ py2pkg('os-testr') }} Requires: {{ py2pkg('PasteDeploy') }}%description%autosetup -n %{sname}-%{version}mv %{buildroot}%{_prefix}%{_sysconfdir} %{buildroot}%{_sysconfdir}/%{sname}%{_sysconfdir}/%{sname}

commit_message:
Add cleanup hook

CIs may need to run some scripts, whatever the test failed or not.
In this case, post hook is power less.
To overcome this issue, the new cleanup hook is added to runanything
we need after the test is over.

Change-Id: Ieb24a417bb4742686f6a5435368b1a76da90a61c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/54/368554/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Keep cleanup hook at the bottom, so that CI can use it to cleanup everything. # Run cleanup hook if we have one. call_hook_if_defined "cleanup_hook"

commit_message:
Bulk creation of SecurityGroups

Currently, Bulk Creation of security groups
is enabled, but due to a mismatch in the function
signature, it is not possible to create security
groups in bulk.
This patch allows the same.

Change-Id: Id1c7a520aa1bb58984b199c86aca2267b98e6b3e
Closes-Bug: #1604662
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/90/365990/18 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def create_security_group_bulk(self, context, security_groups): security_groups)

Add E265 to the pep8 check list

E265 block comment should start with '#'

Change-Id: Ia1712504559ab8d43769d07724937ce65100dc07
Partial-Bug: #1663864
(cherry picked from commit e6db08a184adc0bdac46b01bf14a18b6dc55ad7a)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/05/437205/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(nick-ma-z): The pub-sub mechanism is not initially supported. # The watcher function of Zookeeper only supports # one-time trigger. You have to continuously register # watchers for each children. Moreover, the delay # between trigger and registration causes lose of # events. The DataWatch of Kazoo is also not that # stable and easy to use. Thanks to build-in pub-sub # of dragonflow, we don't need to work hard on zk side
deleted_lines: #NOTE(nick-ma-z): The pub-sub mechanism is not initially supported. # The watcher function of Zookeeper only supports # one-time trigger. You have to continuously register # watchers for each children. Moreover, the delay # between trigger and registration causes lose of # events. The DataWatch of Kazoo is also not that # stable and easy to use. Thanks to build-in pub-sub # of dragonflow, we don't need to work hard on zk side.

commit_message:
Use VDisk storage element to match and remove scsi mappings

The VDisk storage element holds the name property which is used to
match and find the right mapping to remove. The FileIO does not
directly inherit VDisk and the instanceof check fails in the
pypowervm find_map.

Change-Id: Idccfc8ecf5da683072b4f380e2c458c5ca51014c
Closes-Bug: #1666466

subject: Fix can not set is_default in network
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-16 03:15:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient/commit/279410812d853624c7dff2e904979978092195d1', 'message': 'Fix can not set is_default in network

The value of is_default always be None, can not be set by
"network set" command. And the '--default' option can only

commit_message:
Fix can not set is_default in network

The value of is_default always be None, can not be set by
"network set" command. Allow "--default" and "--no-default"
options to be recognized when ``--external`` is not present.

Closes-bug:#1665231

Change-Id: I7a05fc7734a15994f72ca4e47997b4952f1f72f8

commit_message:
[www] Fix footer placement

Mismatched <div> tags were causing display
issues with the footer block. This patch
matches all the <div> tags and does some
other minor cleanup.

Change-Id: Id6fadb343e4ea67ba94463bcad9dc378e286cdff

commit_message:
libvirt: drop MIN_LIBVIRT_UEFI_VERSION

We now require libvirt 1.2.9 as a minimum so
we can drop this compatibility code. Apparently
there was never a test for this condition.

Change-Id: I09757492a2968a0e0a73cf60003a83fd84139f4f

commit_message:
Bump minimum required libvirt/qemu versions for Pike

Based on the libvirt distro support matrix wiki [1] this change
bumps the minimum required version of libvirt to 1.2.9 and
QEMU to 2.1.0. These were both advertised as the next minimums
since Newton, we just never made the change in Ocata.

The next minimum libvirt version is set to 1.3.1 and the next
minimum QEMU version is set to 2.5.0, which is what we gate
on with Ubuntu 16.04 but also falls within the distro support
matrix for a representative set of other supported distros.

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/LibvirtDistroSupportMatrix

Change-Id: I9a972e3fde2e4e552f6fc98350820c07873c3de3

commit_message:
Allow default value of DEV_BASE variable

Currently, DEV_BASE is hard-coded to "/opt",
this patchset uses enviroment variable value if set.

Change-Id: If4548e5f37abf073e76caee5d36f726395916ee4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/86/434586/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: DEV_BASE=${DEV_BASE:-/opt}

commit_message:
playbooks: roles: {ironic,keystone}: Drop --force-reinstall

setuptools seems to have some race issues when forcing a package
reinstallation with 'pip install --upgrade --force-reinstall' as
described in https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/951. Until
a fixed 'pip' or 'setuptools' is released, we drop the
--force-reinstall option in order to avoid the said race.

Closes-Bug: #1667308
Change-Id: I26863dd277c7adfc1097b622069c5222b84351c7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bifrost refs/changes/10/437010/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Raise InvalidInput exception

If invalid input like v4-fixed-ip is given while creating instance,
it raises rescheduled exception as it is not handled. This patch
raises invalid input exception and aborts the build of instance.

Change-Id: I7c4af81ddbb94dde42e889cdb559b59438cf0231
Closes-bug:1526664

commit_message:
Adds attached migration to multibackend-matrix

This test was left behind as it wasn't passing the LVM -> NFS
migration setup. As it wasn't possible to reproduce and fix localy,
let's add this to the gate so we can reproduce the error scenario.
Additionaly to that, some bug fixes need this to be fully tested.

Change-Id: Icd9138c1bc1335e9465184749bf6dd5733c605a3

commit_message:
Revert quota set and show commands

Bugs of quota set and show have been fixed
in OpenStackSDK==0.9.13 by patches [1] [2],
So we can revert the previous fix in OSC
by patches [3] [4]

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/420301/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/419911/
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/420363/
[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/420390/

Change-Id: Iab373532c8f1d8a6092d030de1412a972f3a91a1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/04/428004/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: network_client.update_quota( project, **network_kwargs) network_quota = client.get_quota_default(project)
deleted_lines: from openstack import exceptions as sdk_exceptions from openstack.network.v2 import quota as _quota if hasattr(_quota.Quota, 'allow_get'): # TODO(huanxuan): Remove this block once the fixed # SDK Quota class is the minimum required version. # This is expected to be SDK release 0.9.13 res = network_client._get_resource( _quota.Quota, project, **network_kwargs) if any([res._body.dirty, res._header.dirty]): request = res._prepare_request(prepend_key=True) # remove the id in the body if 'id' in request.body[res.resource_key]: del request.body[res.resource_key]['id'] if res.patch_update: response = network_client.session.patch( request.uri, endpoint_filter=res.service, json=request.body, headers=request.headers ) else: response = network_client.session.put( request.uri, endpoint_filter=res.service, json=request.body, headers=request.headers ) res._translate_response(response, has_body=True) else: network_client.update_quota( project, **network_kwargs) # TODO(dtroyer): Remove the top of this if block once the # fixed SDK QuotaDefault class is the minimum # required version. This is expected to be # SDK release 0.9.13 if hasattr(_quota.QuotaDefault, 'project'): # hack 0.9.11+ quotadef_obj = client._get_resource( _quota.QuotaDefault, project, ) quotadef_obj.base_path = quotadef_obj.base_path % { 'project': project, } try: network_quota = quotadef_obj.get( client.session, requires_id=False, ) except sdk_exceptions.NotFoundException as e: raise sdk_exceptions.ResourceNotFound( message="No %s found for %s" % (_quota.QuotaDefault.__name__, project), details=e.details, response=e.response, request_id=e.request_id, url=e.url, method=e.method, http_status=e.http_status, cause=e.cause, ) # end hack-around else: network_quota = client.get_quota_default(project)

commit_message:
Support the command "zun top"

The BP adds "zun top" which can display the running
progresses inside the container.

Change-Id: I55524598e220e6f227ab789901df9d49fa2357f7
Implements: blueprint support-zun-top
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zun refs/changes/98/432198/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'top': ['GET'] @pecan.expose('json') @exception.wrap_pecan_controller_exception def top(self, container_id, ps=None): container = _get_container(container_id) check_policy_on_container(container.as_dict(), "container:top") utils.validate_container_state(container, 'top') LOG.debug('Calling compute.container_top with %s' % container.uuid) context = pecan.request.context compute_api = pecan.request.compute_api return compute_api.container_top(context, container, ps)

commit_message:
doc: add upgrade notes to the placement devref

This just adds some more detailed docs for upgrading
to Ocata and notable things for the Placement service
and related components as part of that upgrade.

The Ocata release notes will have some of this
information too, but I think it's good to also have
a single place for some of this, like an install/upgrade
guide for Placement.

Change-Id: Id33b9c852bb36ae80a6f29ae33d963a78cbff193
Depends-On: Ie12acb76ec5affba536c3c45fbb6de35d64aea1b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/67/427367/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Upgrade Notes ============= The follow sub-sections provide notes on upgrading to a given target release. .. note:: As a reminder, the `nova-status upgrade check`_ tool can be used to help determine the status of your deployment and how ready it is to perform an upgrade. .. _nova-status upgrade check: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/man/nova-status.html Ocata (15.0.0) ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ * The ``nova-compute`` service will fail to start in Ocata unless the ``[placement]`` section of nova.conf on the compute is configured. As mentioned in the deployment steps above, the Placement service should be deployed by this point so the computes can register and start reporting inventory, allocation and usage information. If the computes are deployed and configured `before` the Placement service, they will continue to try and reconnect in a loop so that you do not need to restart the nova-compute process to talk to the Placement service after the compute is properly configured. * The ``nova.scheduler.filter_scheduler.and FilterScheduler`` in Ocata will fallback to not using the Placement service as long as there are older ``nova-compute`` services running in the deployment. This allows for rolling upgrades of the computes to not affect scheduling for the FilterScheduler. However, the fallback mechanism will be removed in the 16.0.0 Pike release such that the scheduler will make decisions based on the Placement service and the resource providers (compute nodes) registered there. This means if the computes are not reporting into Placement by Pike, build requests will fail with **NoValidHost** errors. * While the FilterScheduler technically depends on the Placement service in Ocata, if you deploy the Placement service `after` you upgrade the ``nova-scheduler`` service to Ocata and restart it, things will still work. The scheduler will gracefully handle the absence of the Placement service. However, the scheduler not being able to make requests to Placement will result in a hard failure in the 16.0.0 Pike release. * It is currently possible to exclude the ``CoreFilter``, ``RamFilter`` and ``DiskFilter`` from the list of enabled FilterScheduler filters such that scheduling decisions are not based on CPU, RAM or disk usage. Once all computes are reporting into the Placement service, however, and the FilterScheduler starts to use the Placement service for decisions, those excluded filters are ignored and the scheduler will make requests based on VCPU, MEMORY_MB and DISK_GB inventory. If you wish to effectively ignore that type of resource for placement decisions, you will need to adjust the corresponding ``cpu_allocation_ratio``, ``ram_allocation_ratio``, and/or ``disk_allocation_ratio`` configuration options to be very high values, e.g. 9999.0.

commit_message:
Fix devstack python-novaclient warning

The following warning is emitted for every nova command using devstack,
stable/ocata.

    site-packages/novaclient/client.py:278:
        UserWarning: The 'tenant_id' argument is deprecated in Ocata and
        its use may result in errors in future releases. As 'project_id'
        is provided, the 'tenant_id' argument will be ignored.

See the following commit for related changes:

    Clarify meaning of project_id var
    9bbe5a87b7df62a7962debba5db7c96555da6761

Change-Id: Ifa5ed16f10a43c9961e98b03fc0535e12d7977ba
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/75/436975/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: os_username, os_password, project_id=os_project_id, project_name=os_project_name, user_id=os_user_id,

commit_message:
Add a generic "wait_for_volume_resource_status" function

This function waits for a volume resource to reach a given status.
The function is a common function for volume, snapshot and backup
resources.

Change-Id: I070a9f84b8b199df22765391482f7d69a5414db3

subject: mysql: set default sql_mode to TRADITIONAL
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-07 11:35:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/c8f5adde0d59f4434a828a604c8118d334f1c4b4', 'message': 'WIP: align default sql_mode value between oslo.db and devstack

Change-Id: Ie6d823c9f8465ac9f2ce4825929d1a50438fab45
Closes-Bug: #1652452
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-07 16:28:48.000000000', 'files': ['lib/databases/mysql'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/88b84094ec1e2a18b6edba91f510cae53bc9c821', 'message': 'mysql: set default sql_mode to TRADITIONAL

We currently use a more permisive STRICT_ALL_TABLES mode, but that's
not what modern MySQL versions default to (i.e. TRADITIONAL):

https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.7/en/sql-mode.html#sql-mode-changes

(non-Devstack deployments will most likely use TRADITIONAL as well)

Due to the fact that we default to TRADITIONAL in oslo.db, this
produces annoying warnings on MySQL 5.7 versions we use in the gate:

    Warning: (3090, u"Changing sql mode 'NO_AUTO_CREATE_USER' is
              deprecated. It will be removed in a future release.")

https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/oslo.db/tree/oslo_db/options.py#n49

Unlike STRICT_ALL_TABLES, TRADITIONAL mode includes NO_AUTO_CREATE_USER,
and MySQL emits this warning on switching it on:

https://dev.mysql.com/worklog/task/?id=8326

So we have two options here:

1) make oslo.db default to STRICT_ALL_TABLES
2) make Devstack default to TRADITIONAL

The latter seems to be more appropriate as:

1) it's what modern MySQL versions default to
2) it's what people are actually using, if they do not override the
   oslo.db default
3) it's more strict

Closes-Bug: #1652452

Change-Id: Ie6d823c9f8465ac9f2ce4825929d1a50438fab45
'}]
commit_message:
mysql: set default sql_mode to TRADITIONAL

We currently use a more permisive STRICT_ALL_TABLES mode, but that's
not what modern MySQL versions default to (i.e. TRADITIONAL):

https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.7/en/sql-mode.html#sql-mode-changes

(non-Devstack deployments will most likely use TRADITIONAL as well)

Due to the fact that we default to TRADITIONAL in oslo.db, this
produces annoying warnings on MySQL 5.7 versions we use in the gate:

    Warning: (3090, u"Changing sql mode 'NO_AUTO_CREATE_USER' is
              deprecated. It will be removed in a future release.")

https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/oslo.db/tree/oslo_db/options.py#n49

Unlike STRICT_ALL_TABLES, TRADITIONAL mode includes NO_AUTO_CREATE_USER,
and MySQL emits this warning on switching it on:

https://dev.mysql.com/worklog/task/?id=8326

So we have two options here:

1) make oslo.db default to STRICT_ALL_TABLES
2) make Devstack default to TRADITIONAL

The latter seems to be more appropriate as:

1) it's what modern MySQL versions default to
2) it's what people are actually using, if they do not override the
   oslo.db default
3) it's more strict

Closes-Bug: #1652452

Change-Id: Ie6d823c9f8465ac9f2ce4825929d1a50438fab45
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/11/430211/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: iniset -sudo $my_conf mysqld sql_mode TRADITIONAL

commit_message:
Fix nova-manage cell_v2 metavar strings

The metavar strings are user-facing (they are shown in usage help
messages). These strings should match the man pages in nova-manage.rst.
For example:

  nova-manage cell_v2 create_cell [--name <cell_name>]
                                  [--transport-url <transport_url>]
                                  [--database_connection <database_connection>]
                                  [--verbose]

Change-Id: I9afd98f2be541b3611a164af0e7530fda1a23396

commit_message:
Fix volume retype with migration as non-admin

As a non-admin user, when retyping a volume from type
A -> B, where both types are in different backends,
Cinder will complete the operation but the volumes will
 not be migrated.

This happens because the retype operation relies in
getting the extra_specs information to the related type,
but extra_specs is only avaiable in admin context.

Closes-bug: #1657806
Change-Id: Id9f39ddab3a3648b8721b711ecf78c18c8293451
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/33/422733/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # If volume types have the same contents, no need to do anything. # Use the admin contex to be able to access volume extra_specs context.elevated(), volume.volume_type_id, new_type_id) new_type = volume_types.get_volume_type(context.elevated(), new_type_id)
deleted_lines: # If volume types have the same contents, no need to do anything context, volume.volume_type_id, new_type_id) new_type = volume_types.get_volume_type(context, new_type_id)

subject: SHA Bump post stable/ocata release for upstream
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-23 15:22:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/f39ddbefc44f7f777cab2fd97029b2e1846bf5ab', 'message': 'SHA Bump post stale/ocata release for upstream

In preparation for OpenStack-Ansible release, this patch performs a SHA
Bump. This lines up with the release of stable/ocata for

commit_message:
SHA Bump post stable/ocata release for upstream

In preparation for OpenStack-Ansible release, this patch performs a SHA
Bump. This lines up with the release of stable/ocata for
cycle-with-intermediary and cycle-with-milestones projects.

Change-Id: Ie67f2d9c5808549d9b44f29e413d7e36c68ff5ba

commit_message:
Fix map_cell_and_hosts help

The help message for the --verbose option claims map_cell_and_hosts
both returns and prints the cell uuid, when really it just prints
the cell uuid and returns 0 on success.

Change-Id: Ia14f2250fedf0bd6456b0088b962460b999b9f8d

commit_message:
Remove unused parameter in _renew_lease_udhcpc

The parameter fixed_ip is not used in _renew_lease_udhcpc,
so this is to remove the parameter.
Further more, _renew_lease_udhcpc is not used anywhere,
shall we remove it?

http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=_renew_lease_dhclient&i=nope&files=&repos=

Change-Id: I2920c547fa906b14ed26f024d6dddcfdb126755a

commit_message:
Fix attachments after attached migration

When migrating an attached volume, after the migration completion,
the volume gots stuck and can not be deleted or detached. This
is happening due an error in the volume completion implementation.
Now, before detaching the source volume, we first save the
attachments and then re-connect then in the destination volume.

Closes-bug: #1659914
Change-Id: Ie9a7815df99869b62209d99bfdcf51b250a8dba3

commit_message:
Clean imports in code

This patch set modifies lines which are importing objects
instead of modules. As per openstack import guide lines, user should
import modules in a file not objects.

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#imports

Change-Id: Iac60690f4ea56a53acfbbbdcf50a360ce8e9ca1d
(cherry picked from commit 4638c818b684825e34e694be3c4f8ff0e824e471)

subject: Fix race in new partitions detecting new/invalid suffixes.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-14 10:20:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/d903caf8eab5f6280ff9ec80ce7d6daa4fef39fc', 'message': 'Fix race in new partitions detecting new/invalid suffixes.

The assumption that we don't need to write an entry in the invalidations
file when the hashes.pkl does not exist turned out to be a premature
optimization and also wrong.

Primarily we should recognize the creation of hashes.pkl is the first
thing that happens in a part when it lands on a new primary.  The code
should be optimized toward the assumption of the most common disk state.

Also, in this case the extra stat calls to check if the hashes.pkl exists
were not only un-optimized - but introducing a race.

Consider the common case:

proc 1                         | proc 2
-------------------------------|---------------------------
a) read then truncate journal  |
b) do work                     | c) append to journal
d) apply "a" to index          |

The index written at "d" may not (yet) reflect the entry writen by proc
2 at "c"; however, it's clearly in the journal so it's easy to see we're
safe.

Adding in the extra stat call for the index existence check increases
the state which can effect correctness.

proc 1                        | proc 2
------------------------------|---------------------------
a) no index, truncate journal |
b) do work                    | b) iff index exists
                              | c) append to journal
d) apply (or create) index    |

If step "c" doesn't happen because the index does not yet exist - the
update is clearly lost.

In our case we'd skip marking a suffix as invalid when the hashes.pkl
does not exist because we know "the next time we rehash" we'll have to
os.listdir suffixes anyway.  But if another process is *currently*
rehashing (and has already done it's os.listdir) instead we've just
dropped an invalidation on the floor.

Don't do that.

Instead - write down the invalidation.  The running rehash is welcome to
proceed on outdated information - as long as the next pass will grab and
hash the new suffix.

Known-Issue(s):

If the suffix already exists there's an even chance the running rehash
will hash in the very update for which we want to invalidate the suffix,
but that's ok it's idempotent.

Co-Author: Pavel Kvasnička <pavel.kvasnicka@firma.seznam.cz>
Co-Author: Alistair Coles <alistair.coles@hpe.com>
Co-Author: Kota Tsuyuzaki <tsuyuzaki.kota@lab.ntt.co.jp>
Related-Change-Id: I64cadb1a3feb4d819d545137eecfc295389794f0
Change-Id: I2b48238d9d684e831d9777a7b18f91a3cef57cd1
Closes-Bug: #1651530

commit_message:
Fix race in new partitions detecting new/invalid suffixes.

The assumption that we don't need to write an entry in the invalidations
file when the hashes.pkl does not exist turned out to be a premature
optimization and also wrong.

Primarily we should recognize the creation of hashes.pkl is the first
thing that happens in a part when it lands on a new primary.  The code
should be optimized toward the assumption of the most common disk state.

Also, in this case the extra stat calls to check if the hashes.pkl exists
were not only un-optimized - but introducing a race.

Consider the common case:

proc 1                         | proc 2
-------------------------------|---------------------------
a) read then truncate journal  |
b) do work                     | c) append to journal
d) apply "a" to index          |

The index written at "d" may not (yet) reflect the entry writen by proc
2 at "c"; however, it's clearly in the journal so it's easy to see we're
safe.

Adding in the extra stat call for the index existence check increases
the state which can effect correctness.

proc 1                        | proc 2
------------------------------|---------------------------
a) no index, truncate journal |
b) do work                    | b) iff index exists
                              | c) append to journal
d) apply (or create) index    |

If step "c" doesn't happen because the index does not yet exist - the
update is clearly lost.

In our case we'd skip marking a suffix as invalid when the hashes.pkl
does not exist because we know "the next time we rehash" we'll have to
os.listdir suffixes anyway.  But if another process is *currently*
rehashing (and has already done it's os.listdir) instead we've just
dropped an invalidation on the floor.

Don't do that.

Instead - write down the invalidation.  The running rehash is welcome to
proceed on outdated information - as long as the next pass will grab and
hash the new suffix.

Known-Issue(s):

If the suffix already exists there's an even chance the running rehash
will hash in the very update for which we want to invalidate the suffix,
but that's ok it's idempotent.

commit_message:
Warn about using EC with isa_l_rs_vand and nparity >= 5

We *know* there are combinations that will prevent decoding, and we're
going to be increasingly aggressive about getting it out of clusters.

Partial-Bug: 1639691
Change-Id: I50159c9d19f2385d5f60112e9aaefa1a68098313

subject: Optimize noop case for suffix rehash
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-14 10:25:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/9d89b7f0e71bc41e33f129e5ed13e2fcf6f44bff', 'message': "Optimize noop case for suffix rehash

REPLICATE calls where everything is in sync and no suffixes have been
invalidated are supposed to be pretty common and fairly cheap.  If an
invalidations files is empty there's no need to perform a truncation
write operation which will presumably at some point have to flush.

Everyone owes Pavel a quarter for the one billion less write ops in prod

... and Matt a nickel for 20ms of not sleep back every unittest run

As a drive by I remove a crufty confusing OSError exception handler
around an open call that would be using O_CREAT in a directory that it
either just created or opened a file from - it wasn't going to raise
ENOENT.  Similarly rather than loose sleep trying to reason about all
the crazy exceptions that actually *could* pop anywhere in this method,
instead I improve the logging where any such exception would be caught.
This way we can get the details we need to focus on only errors that
actually happen.

commit_message:
Optimize noop case for suffix rehash

REPLICATE calls where everything is in sync and no suffixes have been
invalidated are supposed to be pretty common and fairly cheap.  If an
invalidations files is empty there's no need to perform a truncation
write operation which will presumably at some point have to flush.

Everyone owes Pavel a quarter for the one billion less write ops in prod

... and Matt a nickel for 20ms of not sleep back every unittest run

As a drive by I remove a crufty confusing OSError exception handler
around an open call that would be using O_CREAT in a directory that it
either just created or opened a file from - it wasn't going to raise
ENOENT.  Similarly rather than loose sleep trying to reason about all
the crazy exceptions that actually *could* pop anywhere in this method,
instead I improve the logging where any such exception would be caught.
This way we can get the details we need to focus on only errors that
actually happen.

Author: Pavel Kvasnička <pavel.kvasnicka@firma.seznam.cz>
Co-Author: Matthew Oliver <matt@oliver.net.au>

Related-Change-Id: I64cadb1a3feb4d819d545137eecfc295389794f0

commit_message:
Extract test pattern to helper

An existing test in diskfile established an prior art for a pattern to
create a diskfile with a different suffix - I'd like to make use of it
in new tests in multiple unrelated change sets.

Also add a test to demonstrate some existing robustness and prevent
regression.

As described in bug #1558754 a rebalance after removing a device fails
if min_part_seconds_left > 0, despite the note that a rebalance should
remove partitions from removed devices on the next run.

This patch skips the early exit, and lets the builder itself handling
the rebalance. Partitions that shouldn't move now are still not moved
(except for removed devices), and there is still a warning if no
partition has been moved due to the fact that min_part_hours did not yet
pass.

A small test has been added to ensure rebalancing after removing a
device works without using the --force option (tests fails on current
master). Another test ensures that a rebalance after a recent change
(for example increasing a device's weight) does not move partitions and
still reports the former warning message.

Change-Id: I083022d066338cbe6234bab491c7a8e8e0a7b517

commit_message:
Rebalance with min_part_seconds_left > 0

As described in bug #1558754 a rebalance after removing a device fails
if min_part_seconds_left > 0, despite the note that a rebalance should
remove partitions from removed devices on the next run.

This patch skips the early exit, and lets the builder itself handling
the rebalance. Partitions that shouldn't move now are still not moved
(except for removed devices), and there is still a warning if no
partition has been moved due to the fact that min_part_hours did not yet
pass.

A small test has been added to ensure rebalancing after removing a
device works without using the --force option (tests fails on current
master). Another test ensures that a rebalance after a recent change
(for example increasing a device's weight) does not move partitions and
still reports the former warning message.

Closes-Bug: 1558754
Change-Id: I083022d066338cbe6234bab491c7a8e8e0a7b517
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/67/433567/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

or you can pretend_min_part_hours_passed self.run_srb('pretend_min_part_hours_passed') out, err = self.run_srb('rebalance') self.assertIn('No partitions could be reassigned', out) self.assertIn('There is no need to do so at this time', out) def test_rebalance_removed_devices(self): self.create_sample_ring() argvs = [ ["", self.tmpfile, "rebalance", "3"], ["", self.tmpfile, "remove", "d0"], ["", self.tmpfile, "rebalance", "3"]] for argv in argvs: self.assertSystemExit(EXIT_SUCCESS, ringbuilder.main, argv) def test_rebalance_min_part_hours_not_passed(self): self.create_sample_ring() argvs = [ ["", self.tmpfile, "rebalance", "3"], ["", self.tmpfile, "set_weight", "d0", "1000"]] for argv in argvs: self.assertSystemExit(EXIT_SUCCESS, ringbuilder.main, argv) ring = RingBuilder.load(self.tmpfile) last_replica2part2dev = ring._replica2part2dev mock_stdout = six.StringIO() argv = ["", self.tmpfile, "rebalance", "3"] with mock.patch("sys.stdout", mock_stdout): self.assertSystemExit(EXIT_WARNING, ringbuilder.main, argv) expected = "No partitions could be reassigned.\n" + \ "The time between rebalances must be " + \ "at least min_part_hours: 1 hours" self.assertTrue(expected in mock_stdout.getvalue()) # commit_message:
Quarantine malformed database schema SQLite errors

Currently if an sqlite3.DatabaseError is thrown when caused by
a corrupted database schema, it get logged and the database is isn't
quarantined.

This patch adds the malformed database schema case to the list of
SQLite errors in possibly_quarantine that will trigger the db to be
quarantined.

Also it improved the possibly_quarantined unit test to test all existing
exceptions, and catches exceptions based on the real world except we use
in code.

Closes-Bug: #1646247

Change-Id: Id9452c88f8394a2a910c34c69361442543aa206d
(cherry picked from commit 3bde14b)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/90/416090/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

replicas of the same part in a single rebalance.

This change in behavior only effects min_part_hour zero rings, which
are understood to be uncommon in production mostly because of this

With this change, no matter how small your min_part_hours it will
always require at least N rebalances to move N part-replicas of the

enforce min_part_hours, this change adds a _part_moved_bitmap that

commit_message:
For any part, only one replica can move in a rebalance

With a min_part_hours of zero, it's possible to move more than one
replicas of the same part in a single rebalance.

This change in behavior only effects min_part_hour zero rings, which
are understood to be uncommon in production mostly because of this
very specific and strange behavior of min_part_hour zero rings.

With this change, no matter how small your min_part_hours it will
always require at least N rebalances to move N part-replicas of the
same part.

To supplement the existing persisted _last_part_moves structure to
enforce min_part_hours, this change adds a _part_moved_bitmap that
exists only during the life of the rebalance, to track when rebalance
moves a part in order to prevent another replicas of the same part
from being moved in the same rebalance.

Add authors: Clay Gerrard, clay.gerrard@gmail.com
             Christian Schwede, cschwede@redhat.com

Closes-bug: #1586167

Change-Id: Ia1629abd5ce6e1b3acc2e94f818ed8223eed993a
(cherry picked from commit ce26e78)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/16/419816/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_min_part_hours_zero_will_move_one_replica(self): # Only one replica could move, so some zones are quite unbalanced self.assertAlmostEqual(rb.get_balance(), 66.66, delta=0.5) # There was only zone 0 and 1 before adding more devices. Only one # replica should have been moved, therefore we expect 256 parts in zone # 0 and 1, and a total of 256 in zone 2,3, and 4 expected = defaultdict(int, {0: 256, 1: 256, 2: 86, 3: 85, 4: 85}) self.assertEqual(expected, self._partition_counts(rb, key='zone')) parts_with_moved_count = defaultdict(int) for part in range(rb.parts): zones = set() for replica in range(rb.replicas): zones.add(rb.devs[rb._replica2part2dev[replica][part]]['zone']) moved_replicas = len(zones - {0, 1}) parts_with_moved_count[moved_replicas] += 1 # We expect that every partition moved exactly one replica expected = {1: 256} self.assertEqual(parts_with_moved_count, expected) # After rebalancing two more times, we expect that everything is in a # good state rb.rebalance(seed=3) rb.rebalance(seed=3) self.assertEqual(0, rb.dispersion)

commit_message:
Fix multibackend-matrix confs

The command to edit tempest.conf should be run as the same
user that owns that file. This is causing the scripts to run always
with the same backends[1].

[1] http://bit.ly/2juDims

Change-Id: Ie865042c052746b5001f6132c159bc32165021a3

commit_message:
Fix SolidFire cgsnap clone bug

When I initially implemented consistency group support in the SolidFire driver
I did not reailze that a use case/path would involve creating a volume from a
snapshot that was part of a group snap/cgsnap.

Due to the way that SolidFire takes group snapshots, and the naming scheme
that is used for the resulting snapshots, some additional lookups are needed
in order to locate the correct snapshot. This was implemented correct for the
various cgsnap calls but it is missing from the create volume from clone path.
This patch corrects that and the fix was verified against a cluster running
SolidFire release Oxygen 8.0.1.3.

Closes-Bug: #1663059
Change-Id: I8d9bb674e03b55c549ab693a57711e6455eb8f93
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/11/431211/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if snapshot.get('cgsnapshot_id'): # We're creating a volume from a snapshot that resulted from a # consistency group snapshot. Because of the way that SolidFire # creates cgsnaps, we have to search for the correct snapshot. cgsnapshot_id = snapshot.get('cgsnapshot_id') snapshot_id = snapshot.get('volume_id') sf_name = self.configuration.sf_volume_prefix + cgsnapshot_id sf_group_snap = self._get_group_snapshot_by_name(sf_name) return self._create_clone_from_sf_snapshot(snapshot_id, cgsnapshot_id, sf_group_snap, volume)

commit_message:
Add step to docker_puppet_tasks

This patch sets the step correctly for docker_puppet_tasks.
This is now required in order to match the 'step' in some
puppet manifests explicitly so that things like keystone
initialization run correctly.

Closes-bug: #1667454

Change-Id: If2bdd0b1051125674f116f895832b48723d82b3a

added_lines: echo '{"step": %(step)s}' > /etc/puppet/hieradata/docker.json 'no_archive': os.environ.get('NO_ARCHIVE', ''), 'step': os.environ.get('STEP', '')})

commit_message:
Do not follow CNAME when host is in storage_domain

Commit bfbf0d1e78ff47937adb06bce648a0b915c838d1 removed a check that was
meant to avoid to resolve a storage domain. It breaks the behavior of the
middleware as the resolution of a storage domain will return nothing, so
the global resolution will fail.

Example:
  Host header: storage.example.com
  storage_domain: [.storage.example.com]

  Host does not end with one of the storage_domains (because of the dot),
  so the middleware will loop to resolve the CNAME of storage.example.com,
  but it won't succeed because it's a storage_domain.

Closes-Bug: #1311435

Change-Id: If594b816ff2f7025521de716b32c42bf3137f5dd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/66/435766/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if '.' + given_domain in self.storage_domain: return self.app(env, start_response)

commit_message:
global-requirements: Avoid setuptools 34.0.0-34.2.0

setuptools seems to have some race issues when forcing a package
reinstallation with 'pip install --upgrade --force-reinstall' as
described in https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/951. Restrict
newer setuptools until a fixed package is released.

Change-Id: I8bc3f0e84b2812bbf7f8a9f54c870115ebbb052d
Link: https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/951
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/48/436948/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Expand SLO manifest documentation.

The patch adds documentation for the SLO raw format, specifically what
the fields are in relation to the documented format (hash vs etag,
bytes vs size_bytes, and name vs path).

Change-Id: I44c74ad406a6e55e4228f52fac623eeabbd7564f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/10/437110/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: additional fields and different key names. For example, the first manifest in the example above would look like this: .. code:: [{"name": "/cont/object", "hash": "etagoftheobjectsegment", "bytes": 10485760, "range": "1048576-2097151"}, ...] As you can see, some of the fields are renamed compared to the put request: *path* is *name*, *etag* is *hash*, *size_bytes* is *bytes*. The *range* field remains the same.
deleted_lines: additional fields and different key names.

commit_message:
Use setuptools 33.1.1

As per [1] and [2] setuptools 34.0.0-34.2.0 does not handle
re-installs or upgrades properly.

This patch reduces the version we use to the last known
good version.

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/951
[2] https://review.openstack.org/436948

Change-Id: Ic08f6d0035c4bbaa22412ad5f4176c2fe09cee3b
(cherry picked from commit 6a8f21dedba753f5ae46d2f1aa842009b40074b8)

commit_message:
Use overcloud-deploy tag on overcloud-deploy role

This way one can '--skip-tags overcloud-deploy,overcloud-validate' and
have OOOQ deploy an undercloud with seeded data (ctlplane network,
Ironic nodes) but not attempt to deploy overcloud yet.

Change-Id: I989765fd0297b752cddfa128e298945822040568
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/96/436096/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Compact Mitaka database migrations

This compacts all database migrations up to Mitaka into one
initial schema to remove the need to apply every database
change along the way.

Change-Id: I7c9c8ec085131e569a1280bca8d0d75e0c62a8b8

commit_message:
Install guide manual cookiecutter updates

Some more explanation added to the usage of the cookiecutter:
   - From where the cookiecutter should be run
   - What is the meaning of the asked parameters

Plus I've switched step 4 and 5 as the update of test_requirements.txt is
needed for a succesfull build.

The installguide-cookiecutter side of this change is implemented in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/437577/

Change-Id: Iaa6c71d02dc65019d8b1811adc5d3e57fe40033e
Signed-off-by: csatari <gergely.csatari@nokia.com>
Depends-on: I43685feb521a8b0cf53ed4e92dfede8aeddb00b7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/89/437389/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #. Run the Install Guide cookiecutter, one directory level higher than the top-level directory of your projects repository, to create a skeleton for the install guide of your project: $ cookiecutter -f https://git.openstack.org/openstack/installguide-cookiecutter.git .. list-table:: :header-rows: 1 * - Parameter - Explanation - Example * - repo_name - The name of your project. This should be the same as the name of the projects directory - nova, aodh or vitrage * - service - The service name what the project implements - Networking, Telemetry Alarming or Root Cause Analyzis * - codename - The name how the different components of the project are refering to the project - nova, aodh or vitrage as in nova-conductor or vitrage-api top-level of the project repository. If the ``install-guide`` directory does not exist it will be created if it exist the outcome of the cookiecutting will be generated into it.#. Add your installation content, and test the build locally with ``tox``: .. code-block:: console $ tox -e install-guide The local build is in ``install-guide/build/html``.
deleted_lines: #. Run the Install Guide cookiecutter to create a skeleton for your project: $ cookiecutter https://git.openstack.org/openstack/installguide-cookiecutter.git top-level of the project repository. #. Add your installation content, and test the build locally with ``tox``: .. code-block:: console $ tox -e install-guide The local build is in ``install-guide/build/html``.

added_lines: .. note:: A potential issue can exist with the ``python-pywbem`` dependency package, especially M2crypto. To troubleshot and resolve these types of issues, follow these steps. - On Ubuntu: .. code-block:: console # apt-get remove --purge -y python-m2crypto # pip uninstall pywbem # apt-get install python-pywbem - On openSUSE: .. code-block:: console # zypper remove --clean-deps python-m2crypto # pip uninstall pywbem # zypper install python-pywbem - On Red Hat Enterprise Linux, CentOS, and Fedora: .. code-block:: console # yum remove python-m2crypto # sudo pip uninstall pywbem # yum install pywbem

commit_message:
make sections configurable

The list of section identifiers and corresponding display names, and the
order in which they are rendered, was hard-coded.  Some projects want to
customise this, so move it into the Config object so that it can now be
specified via config.yaml, e.g.

    sections:
      - [features, New Features]
      - [issues, Known Issues]
      - [upgrade, Upgrade Notes]
      - [api, API Changes]
      - [security, Security Issues]
      - [fixes, Bug Fixes]

Change-Id: I914572c6a07ca81c54965b4b5a6b6aba50b3a787

commit_message:
Use a valid project_id flavor_access neg tests

Based on substantial use feedback, Nova is validating the project_id
for both quotas and flavor access calls, so that when a 200 success is
returned to the user, it is because the API call actually succeeded,
not a failed call which returns success, and confuses users.

However, the tempest API call uses a non existent project, which we
need to change.

Implements bp:validate-project-with-keystone

Change-Id: I825b14addbe7687a4b943acf929284b72a8f9ac0

commit_message:
Dynamic setting of header markup

As the top level header in index.rst and get_started.rst depends on
cookiecutter.service the length of the header markups should also
depend on the length of cookiecutter.service.

Unfortunatelly I was not able to figure out how to include the macro
from a different template, so there is a copy-paste there.

Change-Id: Iff2255f10690f23de270b84c1bd0cd7de3c611a3
Signed-off-by: csatari <gergely.csatari@nokia.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/installguide-cookiecutter refs/changes/28/437228/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {%- macro set_header_markup(header_text_length) -%} {%- set servicelength = cookiecutter.service|length -%} {%- for _ in range(0, servicelength + header_text_length) -%}={%- endfor -%} {%- endmacro -%} {%- macro set_header(header_text) -%} {{ set_header_markup(header_text|length) }} {{cookiecutter.service}}{{header_text}} {{ set_header_markup(header_text|length) }} {%- endmacro -%} {{ set_header(" service overview") }}

commit_message:
Add composable upgrade workflow for tripleo-quickstart

Implement the composable upgrade workflow for tripleo-quickstart
- Download a newton overcloud image and remove the current one (master)
- Deploy a newton overcloud with the newton tht repo
- Upgrade only the overcloud to master

Change-Id: Ib0ad132f419b2fd3c23287d2f1374909c4ad486d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras refs/changes/80/416480/23 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: use_git_tht_repo: false tht_branch: master overcloud_release: "{{ release }}"

commit_message:
DEBUG Test reboot hard

Force delete the host key to verify the fix for
https://launchpad.net/bugs/1564948.

The latest CirrOS should open port 22 even if the ssh host key was
lost as key are regenerated.

Depends-on: Ibbb35bd2239bec5637d8326185ee626de9975610
Change-Id: Iea74c63925be17a1df894c1a2c23f5ba2793e0c6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/75/421875/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if CONF.validation.run_validation: # NOTE(andreaf) If validation is enabled, run this in a loop # for a few times to increase the change of reproducing an issue # with the host ssh key for _ in range(20): self.server_id = self.rebuild_server(None, validatable=True) self._test_reboot_server('HARD')

commit_message:
Fix the migration to use alarm_history

there is no alarm_change table, so this fails during
migration when using mysql/

Change-Id: Ia0c63681fd8b5bc692d0a52ab587a6d3e430a844
(cherry picked from commit 23552b1c0769a56e8541221965eaf09efefff400)

commit_message:
Add best practices properties to MS Win image example

Add properties to the Windows image example which are best practices:
- Add os-distro
- Add os-version
- Revise os-variant to match other Windows values 8k > 12k

Change-Id: Id829df0a83ac6d32191eb2f13f9873950f7f71a6
Closes-bug: #1663330
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/23/436123/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --vnc --os-type windows --os-variant win2k12 \ --os-distro windows --os-version 2012

commit_message:
Add nova-compute-ironic microservice chart

To be able to use ironic in kolla-kubernetes, microservice chart
for nova-compute-ironic process is required.

Partially-Implements: blueprint more-microservices

Depends-On: Ie5f9da2ed9d923c4e3e78a0873d47d8578f4f89e

Change-Id: I8a9bb1b4192033416809d687ed6d6ac56ecd8e3f
