commit_message:
Add scenario 002-005 config files for multinode scenario jobs

This commit adds config files for the remaining scenario jobs. Although
these are nearly identical, they should in theory change which logs are
collected to reflect the different services
deployed by each scenario.

It also fixes a comment at the beginning explaining why introspection
is disabled. It also removes an extraneous compute_0 host from the list
of overcloud nodes in the config files.

Change-Id: I581cb3e99e9f38f083ec9f55c9e5d9a1643a0e17
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras refs/changes/79/437079/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # We run tempest in this topology instead of ping test. # We set introspection to true and use only the minimal amount of nodes # for this job, but test all defaults otherwise. # TODO: Enable introspection once https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1651719 # is fixed (amoralej) step_introspect: false # Define a single controller node and a single compute node. overcloud_nodes: - name: control_0 flavor: control virtualbmc_port: 6230 - name: compute_0 flavor: compute virtualbmc_port: 6231 composable_services: true deploy_composable_scenario: true composable_scenario: scenario004-multinode.yaml # Tell tripleo how we want things done. extra_args: >- --ntp-server pool.ntp.org network_isolation: true # This enables TLS for the undercloud which will also make haproxy bind to the # configured public-vip and admin-vip. undercloud_generate_service_certificate: false # This enables the deployment of the overcloud with SSL. ssl_overcloud: false # If `test_tempest` is `true`, run tempests tests, otherwise do not # run them. test_ping: false run_tempest: false tempest_workers: 4 # options below direct automatic doc generation by tripleo-collect-logs artcl_gen_docs: true artcl_create_docs_payload: included_deployment_scripts: - undercloud-install - overcloud-custom-tht-script - overcloud-prep-flavors - overcloud-prep-images - overcloud-prep-network - overcloud-deploy - overcloud-deploy-post - overcloud-validate included_static_docs: - env-setup-virt table_of_contents: - env-setup-virt - undercloud-install - overcloud-custom-tht-script - overcloud-prep-flavors - overcloud-prep-images - overcloud-prep-network - overcloud-deploy - overcloud-deploy-post - overcloud-validate

commit_message:
Allow name as positional argument

Make "magnum cluster-create" and "magnum cluster-template-create"
accept name as a positional like the other magnum subcommands.

commit_message:
Simplify magnumclient.shell.OpenStackMagnumShell.main()

This will help with the following flake8 failure:

magnumclient/shell.py:544:1: C901 'OpenStackMagnumShell.main' is too complex (20)
    def main(self, argv):
    ^

Change-Id: Id1def3850112d689d151951f587f58e20fc0b22d
Partially-Implements: blueprint positional-name

commit_message:
Set 0.0.0.0 as default host for Blazar API

This patch sets 0.0.0.0 as default value for the host config option.
This is the aproach used for other OpenStack projects like Heat and
Nova.

Change-Id: Ib356c1c09bee1d6fad7c28ec607166cc0b4db06e
Closes-Bug: #1336856

commit_message:
Remove deprecated image commands/API bindings

We deprecated the image proxy commands and APIs in Newton
due to the 2.36 microversion. We said after Ocata 15.0.0 we
would remove these, which we can do now in Pike.

Note that the list() method on the ImageManager has to be
moved to the GlanceManager since we still need to list images
for the --image-with option on the boot command. The _match_image
method in the shell has to be updated for a glance v2 response
where custom metadata properties are flat in the image body.

This needs to be released with a major version bump.

Change-Id: I2d9fd0243d42538bd1417a42357c17b09368d2a5

FAKE_UUID_1) def test_image_meta_set(self): _out, err = self.run_command('image-meta %s set test_key=test_value' % FAKE_UUID_1) self.assertIn('Command image-meta is deprecated', err) self.assert_called('POST', '/images/%s/metadata' % FAKE_UUID_1, {'metadata': {'test_key': 'test_value'}}) def test_image_meta_del(self): _out, err = self.run_command('image-meta %s delete test_key' % FAKE_UUID_1) self.assertIn('Command image-meta is deprecated', err) self.assert_called('DELETE', '/images/%s/metadata/test_key' % FAKE_UUID_1) @mock.patch('sys.stdout', six.StringIO()) @mock.patch('sys.stderr', six.StringIO()) def test_image_meta_bad_action(self): self.assertRaises(SystemExit, self.run_command, 'image-meta 1 BAD_ACTION test_key=test_value') def test_image_list(self): self.run_command('image-list') self.assert_called('GET', '/images/detail') def test_image_delete(self): _out, err = self.run_command('image-delete %s' % FAKE_UUID_1) self.assertIn('Command image-delete is deprecated', err) self.assert_called('DELETE', '/images/%s' % FAKE_UUID_1) def test_image_delete_multiple(self): self.run_command('image-delete %s %s' % (FAKE_UUID_1, FAKE_UUID_2)) self.assert_called('GET', '/v2/images/' + FAKE_UUID_1, pos=0) self.assert_called('DELETE', '/images/' + FAKE_UUID_1, pos=1) self.assert_called('GET', '/v2/images/' + FAKE_UUID_2, pos=2) self.assert_called('DELETE', '/images/' + FAKE_UUID_2, pos=3) class ShellImageUtilTest(utils.TestCase): def test_deprecated_image_newer(self): @novaclient.v2.shell.deprecated_image def tester(cs): 'foo' self.assertEqual(api_versions.APIVersion('2.35'), cs.api_version) cs = mock.MagicMock() cs.api_version = api_versions.APIVersion('2.9999') tester(cs) self.assertEqual('DEPRECATED: foo', tester.__doc__) def test_deprecated_image_older(self): @novaclient.v2.shell.deprecated_image def tester(cs): 'foo' # since we didn't need to adjust the api_version the mock won't # have cs.client.api_version set on it self.assertFalse(hasattr(cs, 'client')) # we have to set the attribute back on cs so the decorator can # set the value on it when we return from this wrapped function setattr(cs, 'client', mock.MagicMock()) cs = mock.MagicMock() cs.api_version = api_versions.APIVersion('2.1') # we have to delete the cs.client attribute so hasattr won't return a # false positive in the wrapped function del cs.client tester(cs) self.assertEqual('DEPRECATED: foo', tester.__doc__) # the deprecated_network decorator will set cs.client.api_version # after calling the wrapped function self.assertEqual(cs.api_version, cs.api_version)

commit_message:
Add support for network_data.yaml to process templates action

To enable rendering a list of networks we need to include an optional
network_data.yaml file.  We may make this mandatory in a future revision
but since t-h-t doesn't yet contain this file we tolerate it being
missing with a warning.

Change-Id: I9f818912bd8e2a3220e41c8ccbbab3d9063b4d72
Partial-Bug: #1633090
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/21/436621/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Added processing /compute URL for getting list of versions

After implementing blueprint "Ability to run some Nova services under Apache2"(
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/run-nova-services-under-apache2)
it becomes possible not to use separate ports for each openstack service but
share 80 port with different URL prefixes.

Mailing list thread with discussion the details of this feature:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/067147.html.

Openstack wiki page with mapping urls to services:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/URLs.

If nova-api service is started by Apache (or similar),
using 'Alias' directive script name contains alias-prefix.
We get things like: '/ALIAS/NAME/v2', '/ALIAS/NAME/v2.1'
This change makes sure we compose correct url for getting list of versions.

Co-Authored-By: Sergey Nikitin <snikitin@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Pavel Kholkin <pkholkin@mirantis.com>

Closes-Bug: #1471833

Change-Id: I26a436f2a96f560c9ab78351a93a6eaf940da308

added_lines: import re # API version and project-id like "/app-name/v2/{project-id}" or # "/v2/{project-id}", but we need to access the URL which doesn't # contain API version for getting API versions. For that, here # should use raw_request() instead of get(). url = urllib.parse.urlsplit(endpoint) url_parts = url.path.split('/') new_path = re.split(r'v\d+(?:\.\d+)?', url.path)[0] url = list(url) url[2] = new_path return urllib.parse.urlunsplit(url)
deleted_lines: # API version and project-id like "v2/{project-id}", but we need # to access the URL which doesn't contain them for getting API # versions. For that, here should use raw_request() instead of # get(). url = urllib.parse.urlparse(endpoint) return '%s://%s/' % (url.scheme, url.netloc)

commit_message:
Migrate volume/admin service clients

Added unit tests for all client services

Partially implements blueprint migrate-service-clients-to-tempest-lib

Change-Id: Ie2a8bc9d2fd323dd2a601d97cd2bf70d940a0486
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest-lib refs/changes/30/247230/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (C) 2014 eNovance SAS <licensing@enovance.com> # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo_serialization import jsonutils from six.moves.urllib import parse as urllib from tempest_lib.common import rest_client class BaseVolumeQuotasClient(rest_client.RestClient): """ Client class to send CRUD Volume Quotas API requests to a Cinder endpoint """ TYPE = "json" def show_default_quota_set(self, tenant_id): """List the default volume quota set for a tenant.""" url = 'os-quota-sets/%s/defaults' % tenant_id resp, body = self.get(url) self.expected_success(200, resp.status) body = jsonutils.loads(body) return rest_client.ResponseBody(resp, body) def show_quota_set(self, tenant_id, params=None): """List the quota set for a tenant.""" url = 'os-quota-sets/%s' % tenant_id if params: url += '?%s' % urllib.urlencode(params) resp, body = self.get(url) self.expected_success(200, resp.status) body = jsonutils.loads(body) return rest_client.ResponseBody(resp, body) def show_quota_usage(self, tenant_id): """List the quota set for a tenant.""" body = self.show_quota_set(tenant_id, params={'usage': True}) return body def update_quota_set(self, tenant_id, gigabytes=None, volumes=None, snapshots=None): post_body = {} if gigabytes is not None: post_body['gigabytes'] = gigabytes if volumes is not None: post_body['volumes'] = volumes if snapshots is not None: post_body['snapshots'] = snapshots post_body = jsonutils.dumps({'quota_set': post_body}) resp, body = self.put('os-quota-sets/%s' % tenant_id, post_body) self.expected_success(200, resp.status) body = jsonutils.loads(body) return rest_client.ResponseBody(resp, body) def delete_quota_set(self, tenant_id): """Delete the tenant's quota set.""" resp, body = self.delete('os-quota-sets/%s' % tenant_id) self.expected_success(200, resp.status) return rest_client.ResponseBody(resp, body) class VolumeQuotasClient(BaseVolumeQuotasClient): """ Client class to send CRUD Volume Type API V1 requests to a Cinder endpoint """

commit_message:
Move away from include statsd.j2

The statsd.j2 include approach is great, but it is hitting an ansible
bug with Jinja2==2.9.5 which hasn't been fixed with Ansible and doens't
seem to be fixed anytime soon.

Here is an example bug:
https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/20494

This patch also refactors the statsd.j2 import parts, a lot of
if/else statements were not required.

Change-Id: Ib78ac0a8891874b1c2e777fac8f3fb89304e6872
(cherry picked from commit 352969e2d11d80b74485664737a5c0c49b87b14d)

commit_message:
Charm-heleprs sync for AMQP context fix

In Ocata nova uses the transport_url for communication to rabbitmq.
In the charm the default port 5672 was assumed. However, when
rabbitmq uses SSL it changes the port to 5671.

This pulls in the fix which makes the default port explicit and
changes the port when SSL is in use.

Change-Id: Ic9c24d33550c4c899cabca3667871212dabac1f7
Closes-bug: #1667362

subject: service_name & auth_name need to be used properly
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-02 10:51:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-zaqar/commit/6b2cbb246cf0173fd86a1b1a44582897365b01a8', 'message': "service user (auth_name) won't get created in keystone

Using puppet-zaqar module, the service user (auth_name) won't get
created in keystone even after specifying it in custom puppet modules
like fuel plugins or other for deploying the zaqar service.

With this fix changes, service user will be created in keystone
when auth_name is provided.

Change-Id: I7f953b3454695b7790507ee7a637fea9df7a6868
Closes-Bug: #1588295
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-06 13:19:17.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/keystone/auth.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-zaqar/commit/d46227948a62f61073ac64cc538aba4ffdee053d', 'message': 'service_name & auth_name need to be used properly

In puppet-zaqar module, auth_name is used as service title instead of
service name and auth_name overriding code is missing.

with this fix, service_name & auth_name used properly

Change-Id: I7f953b3454695b7790507ee7a637fea9df7a6868
Closes-Bug: #1588295
'}]
commit_message:
service_name & auth_name need to be used properly

In puppet-zaqar module, auth_name is used as service title instead of
service name and auth_name overriding code is missing.

with this fix, service_name & auth_name used properly

Change-Id: I7f953b3454695b7790507ee7a637fea9df7a6868
Closes-Bug: #1588295
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-zaqar refs/changes/63/324363/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: auth_name => $auth_name,

commit_message:
Add release notes for Manila/CephFS with managed Ceph

Previously we could only configure Manila/CephFS with an externally
managed Ceph cluster. By adding CephMDS users can use the TripleO
managed Ceph cluster as well.

Change-Id: If714076e34a639c3df54936f335da4f2684b4533
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/47/425747/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- prelude: > Support for Manila/CephFS with TripleO managed Ceph cluster features: - | It is now possible to configure Manila with CephFS to use a TripleO managed Ceph cluster. When using the Heat environment file at environments/manila-cephfsnative-config.yaml Manila will be configured to use the TripleO managed Ceph cluster if CephMDS is deployed as well, which can be done using the file environments/services/ceph-mds.yaml

commit_message:
Update ci environment for multinode jobs to support Ceph

Adds the CephMon and CephOSD services on the Controller role so
that we can test Ceph if the services are enabled via registry.

Change-Id: I73ee5380b88bf7643ba425a0c833922e330ecade
(cherry picked from commit 54438d35adc1d9e64f1b9c33793a58ddc181d31a)

commit_message:
puppet-pacemaker rhevm stonith fails

When using ovirt/rhevm stonith mechanism, fence packages
could allready be referenced somewhere else in the code
so such a requirement shouldnt sit in the defined type.
Constraints on the stonith resources are also unecessary

Change-Id: I7de2c58fc43529b4b7a91b3656faefccecd51cb5
Closes-Bug: #1553227

- https://apps.fedoraproject.org/packages/puppet
- http://yum.puppetlabs.com/

Change-Id: I511b129a501a2bf50b84f964f455e72284a70a20

split original `is_fedora` function into `is_centos` and `is_fedora` to
allow handle Fedora package separately.

and more, test deb/rpm package link existance before actual install.

also, avoid $ID as variable name, it is system environment variable.

reference:
- https://apps.fedoraproject.org/packages/puppet
- http://yum.puppetlabs.com/

commit_message:
Fix package version on Fedora

puppetlabs provides Fedora specific rpm packages, it would be better to
split original `is_fedora` function into `is_centos` and `is_fedora` to
allow handle Fedora package separately.

and more, test deb/rpm package link existance before actual install.

also, avoid $ID as variable name, it is system environment variable.

reference:
- https://apps.fedoraproject.org/packages/puppet
- http://yum.puppetlabs.com/

Change-Id: I511b129a501a2bf50b84f964f455e72284a70a20
Signed-off-by: guessi <guessi@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration refs/changes/19/288619/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # for current CI test, target to test on puppet 3, but Fedora-Updates ships puppet 4. # also, the `2>/dev/null` is required for hiding `yum2dnf` warning message. # reference: https://apps.fedoraproject.org/packages/puppet PUPPET_PKG=$(yum --showduplicates list puppet 2>/dev/null | awk '$2 !~ /4.*/' | awk 'END{print "puppet-"$2}') $SUDO yum install -y dstat ${PUPPET_PKG}

commit_message:
Expand openstack_integration::gnocchi to support multiple backends

This patch provides the start of the code base to allow openstack_integration::gnocchi
to support multiple backends. ceph is the default.

Change-Id: I55210b1b702d238c5bd7eb70407d755c8bf6992d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration refs/changes/98/339698/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Configure the gnocchi service # # [*backend*] # (optional) Gnocchi backend to use # Values: ceph # class openstack_integration::gnocchi ( $backend = 'ceph', ) { case $backedn { 'ceph': { class { '::gnocchi::storage::ceph': ceph_username => 'openstack', ceph_keyring => '/etc/ceph/ceph.client.openstack.keyring', } } default: { fail("Unsupported backend (${backend})") }

commit_message:
Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due
to the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5
is available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: Icacb9054ade4105b5a3ebad43fc32df484ef428e

commit_message:
Rewrite nova_security_rule to use osclient

The nova_security_rule previously relied on the nova client to manage
rules. This change rewrites the provider to leverage the osclient and
addresses the idempotency issues stemming from the lack of a name
associated with the rule.

Change-Id: I8542e3cb1a24165f238e78a3f33ff0f9bc392672
Closes-Bug: #1571259
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/88/307888/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Nova_aggregate<||> -> Nova_security_group <||> -> Nova_security_rule<||> Nova_security_rule { ensure => present, ip_protocol => 'tcp', ip_range => '0.0.0.0/0', } nova_security_rule { 'http_01': from_port => '80', to_port => '80', security_group => 'global_http' } nova_security_rule { 'http_02': from_port => '443', to_port => '443', security_group => 'global_http' } nova_security_rule { 'ssh_01': from_port => '22', to_port => '22', security_group => 'global_ssh' } nova_security_rule { 'all_01': from_port => '1', to_port => '65535', security_group => 'allow_all' } nova_security_rule { 'all_02': ip_protocol => 'udp', from_port => '1', to_port => '65535', security_group => 'allow_all' } nova_security_rule { 'all_03': ip_protocol => 'icmp', from_port => '1', to_port => '255', security_group => 'allow_all' }

commit_message:
Rewrite nova_security_group to use osclient

nova_security_group uses the old nova client to manage security groups.
This change rewrites the nova_security_group to leverage the osclient
and address idempotency issues with the provider.

Change-Id: I8dd0aede2d422c5192c12da2d1970cbb83a06e91
Related-Bug: #1571259

commit_message:
opencontrail: update keystone section

Use keystone_authtoken section name for keystone parameters.

See neutron_plugin_contrail/plugins/opencontrail/contrail_plugin.py
code, keystone_authtoken parameters are required.

Change-Id: Ic2846e6cb7929c9d90521a875822322f68adc861
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/78/351078/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :keystone_auth_host => 'keystone-server', :keystone_auth_protocol => 'http', :keystone_identity_uri => 'http://keystone-server:35357', is_expected.to contain_neutron_plugin_opencontrail('keystone_authtoken/auth_host').with_value(params[:keystone_auth_host]) is_expected.to contain_neutron_plugin_opencontrail('keystone_authtoken/auth_protocol').with_value(params[:keystone_auth_protocol]) is_expected.to contain_neutron_plugin_opencontrail('keystone_authtoken/auth_url').with_value(params[:keystone_auth_url]) is_expected.to contain_neutron_plugin_opencontrail('keystone_authtoken/admin_user').with_value(params[:keystone_admin_user]) is_expected.to contain_neutron_plugin_opencontrail('keystone_authtoken/admin_tenant_name').with_value(params[:keystone_admin_tenant_name]) is_expected.to contain_neutron_plugin_opencontrail('keystone_authtoken/admin_password').with_value(params[:keystone_admin_password]) is_expected.to contain_neutron_plugin_opencontrail('keystone_authtoken/admin_token').with_value(params[:keystone_admin_token]) is_expected.to contain_neutron_plugin_opencontrail('keystone_authtoken/identity_uri').with_value(params[:keystone_identity_uri])

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-02 18:04:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron/commit/673f2443ee644b20cc0f053f3247aac6b4a8f002', 'message': "service user (auth_name) won't get created in keystone

Using puppet-neutron module, the service user (auth_name) won't get
created in keystone even after specifying it in custom puppet modules
like fuel plugins or other for deploying the neutron service.

With this fix changes, service user will be created in keystone
when auth_name is provided.

Change-Id: I4a0637e33f0993b61f2fa78a5e9c361da4ae8c73
Closes-Bug: #1588474
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-04 12:13:16.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/keystone/auth.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron/commit/8a1f0e3a82f6f1033d65972a08d7370323cbd865', 'message': 'service_name & auth_name need to be used properly

In puppet-neutron module, auth_name is used as service title instead of
service name and auth_name overriding code is missing.

With this fix changes, service_name & auth_name used properly

Change-Id: I4a0637e33f0993b61f2fa78a5e9c361da4ae8c73
Closes-Bug: #1588474
'}]
commit_message:
service_name & auth_name need to be used properly

In puppet-neutron module, auth_name is used as service title instead of
service name and auth_name overriding code is missing.

With this fix changes, service_name & auth_name used properly

Change-Id: I4a0637e33f0993b61f2fa78a5e9c361da4ae8c73
Closes-Bug: #1588474
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/40/324740/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: auth_name => $auth_name,

commit_message:
Adding Cisco Prime Network Registrar DHCP Plugin Support. Added
required services for CPNR

Change-Id: Id37793a6069c2342606ff8350e5d02da2df05614
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/22/158522/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*cpnr_http_server*] # (optional) This option is required when specifing dhcp_driver = neutron.plugins.cisco.cpnr.dhcp_driver.CpnrDriver. # Specifies the ip and port that the CPNR host is listening on. # Defaults to undef # # [*cpnr_http_user*] # (optional) This option is required when specifing dhcp_driver = neutron.plugins.cisco.cpnr.dhcp_driver.CpnrDriver. # Specifies the http user for logging into CPNR http server # Defaults to undef # # [*cpnr_http_password*] # (optional) This option is required when specifing dhcp_driver = neutron.plugins.cisco.cpnr.dhcp_driver.CpnrDriver. # Specifies http user password to use when logging into CPNR http server # Defaults to undef # # [*cpnr_external_interface*] # (optional) This option is optional when specifing dhcp_driver = neutron.plugins.cisco.cpnr.dhcp_driver.CpnrDriver. # Specifies which interface to communicate with the CPNR server on # Defaults to eth0 # # [*cpnr_dhcp_server_addr*] # (optional) This option is required when specifing dhcp_driver = neutron.plugins.cisco.cpnr.dhcp_driver.CpnrDriver. # Specifies CPNR server DHCP ip address # Defaults to undef # # [*cpnr_dhcp_server_port*] # (optional) This option is optional when specifing dhcp_driver = neutron.plugins.cisco.cpnr.dhcp_driver.CpnrDriver. # Specifies CPNR DHCP Port # Defaults to 67 # # [*cpnr_dns_server_addr*] # (optional) This option is required when specifing dhcp_driver = neutron.plugins.cisco.cpnr.dhcp_driver.CpnrDriver. # Specifies CPNR DNS Server # Defaults to undef # # [*cpnr_dns_server_port*] # (optional) This option is optional when specifing dhcp_driver = neutron.plugins.cisco.cpnr.dhcp_driver.CpnrDriver. # Specifies CPNR DNS Port # Defaults to 53 # $enable_metadata_network = false, $cpnr_http_server = undef, $cpnr_http_user = undef, $cpnr_http_password = undef, $cpnr_external_interface = 'eth0', $cpnr_dhcp_server_addr = undef, $cpnr_dhcp_server_port = 67, $cpnr_dns_server_addr = undef, $cpnr_dns_server_port = 53 /\.CpnrDriver/: { if($::osfamily != 'Redhat') { # CPNR is currently supported only on Redhat/CentOS based OS fail("Unsupported osfamily ${::osfamily} for CPNR Driver") } validate_re($cpnr_http_server,'(25[0-5]|2[0-4][0-9]|[01]?[0-9][0-9]?)\.(25[0-5]|2[0-4][0-9]|[01]?[0-9][0-9]?)\.(25[0-5]|2[0-4][0-9]|[01]?[0-9][0-9]?)\.(25[0-5]|2[0-4][0-9]|[01]?[0-9][0-9]?)') validate_string($cpnr_http_user) validate_string($cpnr_http_password) validate_string($cpnr_external_interface) validate_re($cpnr_dhcp_server_addr,'(25[0-5]|2[0-4][0-9]|[01]?[0-9][0-9]?)\.(25[0-5]|2[0-4][0-9]|[01]?[0-9][0-9]?)\.(25[0-5]|2[0-4][0-9]|[01]?[0-9][0-9]?)\.(25[0-5]|2[0-4][0-9]|[01]?[0-9][0-9]?)') validate_re($cpnr_dhcp_server_port,'^\d+$') validate_re($cpnr_dns_server_addr,'(25[0-5]|2[0-4][0-9]|[01]?[0-9][0-9]?)\.(25[0-5]|2[0-4][0-9]|[01]?[0-9][0-9]?)\.(25[0-5]|2[0-4][0-9]|[01]?[0-9][0-9]?)\.(25[0-5]|2[0-4][0-9]|[01]?[0-9][0-9]?)') validate_re($cpnr_dns_server_port,'^\d+$') ensure_packages(['openstack-cisco-cpnrdhcp-driver']) $enable_cpnr = true } if $enable_cpnr { neutron_dhcp_agent_config { 'cisco_pnr/http_server': value => $cpnr_http_server; 'cisco_pnr/http_username': value => $cpnr_http_user; 'cisco_pnr/http_password': value => $cpnr_http_password; 'cisco_pnr/external_interface': value => $cpnr_external_interface; 'cisco_pnr/dhcp_server_addr': value => $cpnr_dhcp_server_addr; 'cisco_pnr/dhcp_server_port': value => $cpnr_dhcp_server_port; 'cisco_pnr/dns_server_addr': value => $cpnr_dns_server_addr; 'cisco_pnr/dns_server_port': value => $cpnr_dns_server_port; } }

commit_message:
Add support for auth_version

There is no parameter in the puppet module to configure keystone_auth
called "auth_version" and this parameter is mentioned in the
Mistral installation guide

Change-Id: Icf7332fef0c4a964a66b911b8695f143d89535bc
Closes-Bug: #1585964
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-mistral refs/changes/45/321445/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*auth_version*] # Defaults to 'v3' # $auth_version = 'v3' 'keystone_authtoken/auth_version': value => $auth_version;

commit_message:
Bump the services version

* move centos/oraclelinux from master to rdo ocata release
* bump the version number to final release for source installation.

Change-Id: I79db5a19e9b7abb628efb4b947c67c903f16db33

subject: [daemon] Close inherited filedescriptors after forking
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-26 10:07:55.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_rootwrap/client.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.rootwrap/commit/f8fbd3efe409e2722ba94d749350d23d6aabff48', 'message': "[daemon] Close inherited filedescriptors after forking

We don't want to keep listening on the parent's sockets (e.g. when
started by neutron-openvswitch agent) after forking the rootwrap
daemon.

Closes-Bug: #1658973
Change-Id: I3e364e9d3ad4e2fcd6f4d8f52f847ec9fa944572
(cherry picked from commit 458d79b61abb1a9ad36ce4868cf248ddb21c80a7)
"}]
commit_message:
[daemon] Close inherited filedescriptors after forking

We don't want to keep listening on the parent's sockets (e.g. when
started by neutron-openvswitch agent) after forking the rootwrap
daemon.

Closes-Bug: #1658973
Change-Id: I3e364e9d3ad4e2fcd6f4d8f52f847ec9fa944572
(cherry picked from commit 458d79b61abb1a9ad36ce4868cf248ddb21c80a7)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.rootwrap refs/changes/07/425607/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: stderr=subprocess.PIPE, close_fds=True)

commit_message:
Deprecate barbican config options

All barbican config options in Nova are now
deprecated and may be removed in a future release.
All of these options are moved to the
Castellan library.

Change-Id: Ic48e9509992a0a774712c1e5d102415e9ca3e090
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/71/350871/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- deprecations: - All barbican config options in Nova are now deprecated and may be removed as early as 15.0.0 release. All of these options are moved to the Castellan library.

"}, {'number': 14, 'created': '2016-01-11 08:21:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/e441a7edfce030096c1c12e1673c448ce1670c06', 'message': "Add new limit_portsec_domain attr for port

limit_portsec_domain of port indicates the scope of the port_security,
and this function is implemented within portsecurity extension. It could
be one of ['none', 'mac-spoofing-only'].

Only when port_security_enabled is True, we can set
limit_portsec_domain. Value 'none' indicates that port_security works
both in L2 and L3, no limit here which as before; 'mac-spoofing-only'
indicates that limit port_security works only in L2 domain.

When port_security_enabled is False, limit_portsec_domain will be auto
set to 'all' in background.

This patch will add the API for this attribute.

DocImpact: Add a description for limit_portsec_domain
APIImpact

Partially Implements: blueprint vm-without-l3-address

"}, {'number': 15, 'created': '2016-01-12 10:23:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/0128b5f3a7f6f1507747eb6e34af4b2d9ea12359', 'message': "Add new limit_portsec_domain attr for port

limit_portsec_domain of port indicates the scope of the port_security,
and this function is implemented within portsecurity extension. It could
be stored with one of ['all', 'none', 'mac-spoofing-only',
'not-support']. But user only could set ['none', 'mac-spoofing-only']
from API.

When the plugin not support this attr, the value would be filled with
'not-support' automatically.

When the plugin support the attr:
    - limit-portsec works only when port_security_enabled is True.
        Value 'none' indicates that port_security works both in L2 and
        L3, which means none limitation as before;
        Value 'mac-spoofing-only' indicates that limit port_security
        works only in L2 domain.
    - When port_security_enabled is False, limit_portsec_domain will be
      auto set to 'all' in background.

This patch will add the API for this attribute.

DocImpact: Add a description for limit_portsec_domain
APIImpact

Partially Implements: blueprint vm-without-l3-address

Change-Id: I28fd7f96c86905f2bf035fae9ae0ee2d81c242a7

When the plugin not support this new attr, it will be fill by 'not-support'

When the plugin support the attr:
    - limit-portsec works only when port_security_enabled is True.
        Value 'full' indicates that port_security works both in L2 and
        L3, which means none limitation as before;
        Value 'mac-spoofing-only' indicates that limit port_security
        works only in L2 domain.
    - When port_security_enabled is False, limit_portsec_domain will be
      auto set to 'none' automatically in background.

This patch adds the API for this attribute.

DocImpact: Add a description for limit_portsec_domain

commit_message:
Add new limit_portsec_domain attr for port

limit_portsec_domain of port indicates the scope of the port_security, and this
attribute is implemented within portsecurity extension for ML2 plugin. It could
be stored with one of ['full', 'none', 'l2-only']. But user only
could set ['full', 'l2-only'] from API.

When the plugin not support this new attr, it will be fill by 'not-support'
automatically. And if user set it from API, there will be exception raised.

When the plugin support the attr:
    - limit-portsec works only when port_security_enabled is True.
        Value 'full' indicates that port_security works both in L2 and
        L3, which means none limitation as before;
        Value 'l2-only' indicates that limit port_security
        works only in L2 domain.
    - When port_security_enabled is False, limit_portsec_domain will be
      auto set to 'none' automatically in background.

This patch adds the API for this attribute.

DocImpact: Add a description for limit_portsec_domain
APIImpact

Partially Implements: blueprint vm-without-l3-address

Change-Id: I28fd7f96c86905f2bf035fae9ae0ee2d81c242a7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/36/250036/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: limit_portsec = neutron.plugins.ml2.extensions.limit_portsec:LimitPortSecExtensionDriver

commit_message:
Add config for centosci/ocata-cloudsig-stable

This is required for pipeline testing cloudsig-stable
repo in RDO-CI

Change-Id: I5a96ded09715029f5fff39cfcad2baeeb3732051
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/30/437030/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: release: ocata undercloud_image_url: http://artifacts.ci.centos.org/artifacts/rdo/images/ocata/cbs/cloudsig-stable/testing/undercloud.qcow2 overcloud_image_url: http://artifacts.ci.centos.org/artifacts/rdo/images/ocata/cbs/cloudsig-stable/testing/overcloud-full.tar ipa_image_url: http://artifacts.ci.centos.org/artifacts/rdo/images/ocata/cbs/cloudsig-stable/testing/ironic-python-agent.tar repos: - type: package pkg_name: centos-release-openstack-ocata custom_cmd: 'sudo yum install -y --enablerepo=extras' repo_cmd_after: | sudo yum-config-manager --save --setopt centos-ceph-jewel.gpgcheck=0 sudo yum-config-manager --save --setopt centos-qemu-ev.gpgcheck=0 sudo yum-config-manager --save --setopt centos-openstack-ocata.gpgcheck=0 sudo yum repolist sudo yum update -y overcloud_repo_paths: - "$(ls /etc/yum.repos.d/CentOS-OpenStack-ocata*)" - "$(ls /etc/yum.repos.d/CentOS-QEMU*)" - "$(ls /etc/yum.repos.d/CentOS-Ceph-*)"

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-02 18:38:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-glance/commit/d5abeb101461868b15e80cd9df2138cef62ba03c', 'message': "service user (auth_name) won't get created in keystone

Using puppet-glance module, the service user (auth_name) won't get
created in keystone even after specifying it in custom puppet modules
like fuel plugins or other for deploying the glance service.

With this fix changes, service user will be created in keystone
when auth_name is provided.

Change-Id: I03d6f1bd8892910394f99c03206bfc19d997d80a
Closes-Bug: #1588490

with this fix, service_name & auth_name used properly

Change-Id: I03d6f1bd8892910394f99c03206bfc19d997d80a
Closes-Bug: #1588490
'}]
commit_message:
service_name & auth_name need to be used properly

In puppet-glance module, auth_name is used as service title instead of
service name and auth_name overriding code is missing.

with this fix, service_name & auth_name used properly

Change-Id: I03d6f1bd8892910394f99c03206bfc19d997d80a
Closes-Bug: #1588490
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-glance refs/changes/58/324758/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: auth_name => $auth_name,

commit_message:
setup available loop back device

setup_test_volume make loop back device with /dev/loop2, even if the
/dev/loop2 is used by others. When setup test volume, we should find
an available loop device to use. This patch is to fix this bug.

Change-Id: I12a2b30557bc3406aece12bee421410013e0a536
Closes-Bug: #1619176

added_lines: $loopback_device = inline_template("<%= `losetup -f`.split()[0] %>") unless => "losetup -f ${volume_path}/${volume_name}",

commit_message:
Fix fastest-infra-wheel-mirror.py for CentOS.

on CentOS:
In [2]: platform.linux_distribution()
Out[2]: ('CentOS Linux', '7.2.1511', 'Core')

Also don't add repo_build_pip_extra_indexes if the mirror list is empty

Change-Id: Ia17915a03e7460689a8e403f93bcc87485cde13d
(cherry picked from commit f09e0a27f5b2b92c6db5b789bb0d7f77773c18d0)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/04/436704/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {% if repo_build_pip_extra_indexes is defined and repo_build_pip_extra_indexes|length > 0 %}

commit_message:
Fix ansible-lint.sh script for roles.

- According to the ansible-lint documentation, we can pass a role directory as
  an argument. But due to https://github.com/willthames/ansible-lint/issues/210,
  the role directory has to contain a trailing slash!

- This patch fixes the following ansible-lint rules:
  * ANSIBLE0004: Git checkouts must contain explicit version
  * ANSIBLE0008: Deprecated sudo
  * ANSIBLE0011: All tasks should be named
  * ANSIBLE0014: Environment variables don't work as part of command
  * ANSIBLE0015: Using bare variables is deprecated

- Temporarily skipping the following ansible-lint rules (Fixes will be part of
  others patches):
  * ANSIBLE0007: Using command rather than an argument to e.g file
    We have a lot of 'rm' command and we should use file module instead
  * ANSIBLE0012: Commands should not change things if nothing needs doing
  * ANSIBLE0013: Use Shell only when shell functionality is required

Change-Id: I3d5591ea9fd1691e8115d7093db87781a08a6082
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras refs/changes/88/421788/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pushd roles find . -type f -regex '.*\.y[a]?ml' -print0 | xargs -0 ansible-lint -x $SKIPLIST || lint_error=1 popd

commit_message:
Always allow setting keystone token/user/pass/project/domain

This will permit setting of keystone token/user/pass/project/domain
with both keystone identity v2.0 and v3

Previously it wasn't possible to set user/pass/project with v2.0.

Change-Id: Ieb316902361eece1b0c19947d5acd3598c760415
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ceph refs/changes/55/389355/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Optional. Default is undef if $rgw_keystone_version == 'v3' { } } ceph_config { "client.${name}/rgw_keystone_admin_domain": value => $rgw_keystone_admin_domain; "client.${name}/rgw_keystone_admin_project": value => $rgw_keystone_admin_project; "client.${name}/rgw_keystone_admin_user": value => $rgw_keystone_admin_user; "client.${name}/rgw_keystone_admin_password": value => $rgw_keystone_admin_password; "client.${name}/rgw_keystone_admin_token": value => $rgw_keystone_admin_token;
deleted_lines: # Optional. Default is 'openstack' if $rgw_keystone_version == 'v2.0' { if $rgw_keystone_admin_token == undef { fail( 'Missing rgw_keystone_admin_token for Keystone V2 integration') } ceph_config { "client.${name}/rgw_keystone_admin_token": value => $rgw_keystone_admin_token; } } elsif $rgw_keystone_version == 'v3' { "client.${name}/rgw_keystone_admin_domain": value => $rgw_keystone_admin_domain; "client.${name}/rgw_keystone_admin_project": value => $rgw_keystone_admin_project; "client.${name}/rgw_keystone_admin_user": value => $rgw_keystone_admin_user; "client.${name}/rgw_keystone_admin_password": value => $rgw_keystone_admin_password; "client.${name}/rgw_keystone_admin_token": ensure => absent; } } else { fail("Unsupported keystone version: ${rgw_keystone_version}")

Split installed packages per role

This will only install the packages needed by each role.

Closes-Bug: 1629933

commit_message:
Fix the logic to skip SELinux labeling of block devices

Previously the unless clause was cusing the SELinux label to
happen for block devices too.

Closes-Bug: 1617310
Change-Id: I4ab32e5f796609cf2f985e989c6dc04d0eb37190
(cherry picked from commit 309ef4819b4c1ddbcc83e43fc931a2135882fa68)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ceph refs/changes/39/377839/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: unless => "test -b ${data} || (semanage fcontext -l | grep ${data})",

commit_message:
Ensure SELinux file context is applied on data directories

When SELinux is in 'enforcing' mode, we need to label the data
directories.

Change-Id: Ic2c376999315c89ae05e45a2aab31cacf3369b6a
Closes-Bug: 1611893
(cherry picked from commit f13493abc38cb13eec94bf203f15ec1d26d7ad28)

commit_message:
Update Craton's job layout

We would like to start making sure our docs build as well as making our
experimental job voting. We have had several reviews that successfully
used the experimental job and we'd like it to be voting at this point.

Successful uses of the experimental job:
- https://review.openstack.org/432283
- https://review.openstack.org/434506
- https://review.openstack.org/435038

Change-Id: I01eff9b333d12ea40f6ffc0500f18c368403dc51

commit_message:
Add rgw_key to profile/params.pp

This patch add support for the optional parameter rgw_key to the
profile/params.pp. This allows the RGW keyring secret to be passed
in as hiera value

Change-Id: Id52648888f3db1537b95190b7eb41777bac36eed

commit_message:
Add purge_config option

Add the option in order to facilitate management.
User can ensure that only the options they hoped
are configured.

Change-Id: I2eadadd9abd2c5686fc140b2ff2f11afa011e3f3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-barbican refs/changes/95/326195/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*purge_config*] # (optional) Whether to set only the specified config options # in the barbican config. # Defaults to false. # $purge_config = false, resources { 'barbican_config': purge => $purge_config, }

commit_message:
service_name & auth_name need to be used properly

In puppet-ceilometer module, auth_name is used as service title instead of
service name and auth_name overriding code is missing.

with this fix, service_name & auth_name used properly

Change-Id: Ic559e73c7b897e1db6a79b36e61bf52220fa5acd
Closes-Bug: #1588504
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ceilometer refs/changes/27/325927/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ::keystone::resource::service_identity { $service_name_real: auth_name => $auth_name,

Using Rally to benchmark Keystone in apache, large gains are made by using multiple processes to host 6 Keystone threads each.

Action	Min (sec)	Median (sec)	90%ile (sec)	95%ile (sec)	Max (sec)	Avg (sec)	Success	Count

commit_message:
Tune number of apache processes/threads for Keystone in apache.

1) Change the default value for threads to be '1'.
2) Change the default value for workers to be $:os_workers:
3) If workers > 32, send a Puppet warning because this scenario is
   usually not helpful.

Using Rally to benchmark Keystone in apache, large gains are made by
using multiple processes to host Keystone rather than multiple threads.

Results posted here: http://paste.openstack.org/show/492167/

The above was tested on a 32 logical core machine at 256 constant
concurrency.

Co-Authorized-By: Alex Krzos <akrzos@redhat.com>
Co-Authorized-By: Emilien Macchi <emilien@redhat.com>
Co-Authorized-By: Adam Young <ayoung@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Id133ba5ed83fca7c75510f31eada313542031672
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone refs/changes/42/297342/14 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $workers = $::processorcount, $threads = 6,

commit_message:
Move Eventlet configuration to correct section.

The eventlet configuration placed under DEFAULT is deprecated
and raises a warning.  This patch place the configuration under
the right section.

Change-Id: I73f0e468ad21dfebcbca2541493cae0b0166947b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone refs/changes/60/344360/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Eventlet configuration keystone_config { 'eventlet_server/public_bind_host': value => $public_bind_host; 'eventlet_server/admin_bind_host': value => $admin_bind_host; 'eventlet_server/public_port': value => $public_port; 'eventlet_server/admin_port': value => $admin_port; }

commit_message:
Refactor keystone::resource::authtoken

This patch aims to make keystone::resource::authtoken work
with current keystonemiddleware, and will use this to replace
duplicated keystone_authtoken parameters in other modules.

B/C the define has not been maintained for a long time,
almost all of parameters have been removed or deprecated in
master branch of keystonemiddleware.

To keep compatbility, this patch reserves all parameters, and
add warning info to notify which parameters have been removed
and which have been deprecated.

Closes-Bug: #1533476
Change-Id: I14415c56891183eead4880ea52cc12fc5bf516ee

added_lines: # config resource. It supports all of the authentication parameters specified at # https://github.com/openstack/keystonemiddleware/blob/master/keystonemiddleware/auth_token/__init__.py.# === Parameters:# (Required) The name of the resource corresponding to the config file. For example,# [*auth_uri*] # (Required) Complete public Identity API endpoint. (string value)# [*auth_version*] # (Optional) API version of the admin Identity API endpoint. (string value) # Defaults to false.# [*delay_auth_decision*] # (Optional) Do not handle authorization requests within the middleware, but # delegate the authorization decision to downstream WSGI components. (boolean value) # Defaults to false.# [*http_connect_timeout*] # (Optional) Request timeout value for communicating with Identity API server. # Defaults to false.# [*http_request_max_retries*] # (Optional) How many times are we trying to reconnect when communicating with Identity # API Server. (integer value) # Defaults to 3.# [*cache*] # (Optional) Env key for the swift cache. # Defaults to false.# [*certfile*] # (Optional) Required if identity server requires client certificate (string value) # Defaults to false.# [*keyfile*] # (Optional) Required if identity server requires client certificate (string value) # Defaults to false.# [*cafile*] # (Optional) A PEM encoded Certificate Authority to use when verifying HTTPs connections. # Defaults to system CAs. (string value) # Defaults to false.# (Optional) If true, explicitly allow TLS without checking server cert against any # certificate authorities. # Defaults to false. # # [*region_name*] # (Optional) The region in which the identity server can be found. (string value) # Defaults to false. # # [*signing_dir*] # (Optional) Directory used to cache files related to PKI tokens. (string value) # Defaults to false. # # [*memcached_servers*] # (Optionally) specify a list of memcached server(s) to use for caching. If left # undefined, tokens will instead be cached in-process. (list value) # Defaults to false. # # [*token_cache_time*] # (Optionally) In order to prevent excessive effort spent validating tokens, the middleware # caches previously-seen tokens for a configurable duration (in seconds). # Set to -1 to disable caching completely. (integer value) # Defaults to false. # # [*revocation_cache_time*] # In order to prevent excessive effort spent validating tokens, the middleware # caches previously-seen tokens for a configurable duration (in seconds). Set # to -1 to disable caching completely. (integer value) # Defaults to 10. # # [*memcache_security_strategy*] # (Optional) If defined, indicate whether token data should be authenticated or # authenticated and encrypted. Acceptable values are MAC or ENCRYPT. If MAC, # token data is authenticated (with HMAC) in the cache. If ENCRYPT, token data # is encrypted and authenticated in the cache. If the value is not one of these # options or empty, auth_token will raise an exception on initialization. # (string value) # Defaults to false. # # [*memcache_secret_key*] # (Optional, mandatory if memcache_security_strategy is defined) This string is # used for key derivation. (string value) # Defaults to false. # # [*memcache_pool_dead_retry*] # (Optional) Number of seconds memcached server is considered dead before it is tried again. (integer value) # Defaults to 300. # # [*memcache_pool_maxsize*] # (Optional) Maximum total number of open connections to every memcached # server. (integer value) # Defaults to 10. # # [*memcache_pool_socket_timeout*] # (Optional) Socket timeout in seconds for communicating with a memcached # server. (integer value) # Defaults to 3. # # [*memcache_pool_unused_timeout*] # (Optional) Number of seconds a connection to memcached is held unused in the pool before it is closed. (integer value) # Defaults to 60. # # [*memcache_pool_conn_get_timeout*] # (Optional) Number of seconds that an operation will wait to get a memcached # client connection from the pool. (integer value) # Defaults to 10. # # [*memcache_use_advanced_pool*] # (Optional) Use the advanced (eventlet safe) memcached client pool. The # advanced pool will only work under python 2.x. (boolean value) # Defaults to false. # # [*include_service_catalog*] # (Optional) Indicate whether to set the X-Service-Catalog header. If False, # middleware will not ask for service catalog on token validation and will not # set the X-Service-Catalog header. (boolean value) # Defaults to true. # # [*enforce_token_bind*] # (Optional) Used to control the use and type of token binding. Can be set to: "disabled" # to not check token binding. "permissive" (default) to validate binding # information if the bind type is of a form known to the server and ignore it # if not. "strict" like "permissive" but if the bind type is unknown the token # will be rejected. "required" any form of token binding is needed to be # allowed. Finally the name of a binding method that must be present in tokens. # Defaults to permissive. # # [*check_revocations_for_cached*] # (Optional) If true, the revocation list will be checked for cached tokens. This requires # that PKI tokens are configured on the identity server. (boolean value) # Defaults to false. # # [*hash_algorithms*] # (Optional) Hash algorithms to use for hashing PKI tokens. This may be a single algorithm # or multiple. The algorithms are those supported by Python standard # hashlib.new(). The hashes will be tried in the order given, so put the # preferred one first for performance. The result of the first hash will be # stored in the cache. This will typically be set to multiple values only while # migrating from a less secure algorithm to a more secure one. Once all the old # tokens are expired this option should be set to a single value for better # performance. (list value) # defaults to 'md5'. # # [*identity_uri*] # (Optional) Complete admin Identity API endpoint. This should specify the unversioned # root endpoint e.g. https://localhost:35357/ (string value) # # [*admin_user*] # (Required) Service username. (string value) # # [*admin_password*] # (Required) Service user password. (string value) # # [*admin_tenant_name*] # (Optional) Service tenant name. (string value) # Defaults to 'admin'. # # [*auth_type*] # (Optional) Authentication type to load # Defaults to false. # # [*auth_section*] # (Optional) Config Section from which to load plugin specific options # Defaults to false. # # === Deprecated: # # [*auth_admin_prefix*] # [*auth_host*] # [*auth_port*] # [*auth_protocol*] # [*auth_url*] # [*admin_token*] # [*auth_plugin*] # # === Removed: # [*username*] # [*password*] # [*user_id*] # [*user_domain_name*] # [*user_domain_id*] # [*project_name*] # [*project_id*] # [*project_domain_name*] # [*project_domain_id*] # [*domain_name*] # [*domain_id*] # [*default_domain_name*] # [*default_domain_id*] # [*trust_id*] # [*cacert*] # [*cert*] # [*key*] $admin_user, $admin_password, $auth_uri, $auth_version = false, $delay_auth_decision = false, $http_connect_timeout = false, $http_request_max_retries = 3, $cache = false, $certfile = false, $keyfile = false, $cafile = false, $insecure = false, $region_name = false, $signing_dir = false, $memcached_servers = false, $token_cache_time = false, $revocation_cache_time = 10, $memcache_security_strategy = false, $memcache_secret_key = false, $memcache_pool_dead_retry = 300, $memcache_pool_maxsize = 10, $memcache_pool_socket_timeout = 3, $memcache_pool_unused_timeout = 60, $memcache_pool_conn_get_timeout = 10, $memcache_use_advanced_pool = false, $include_service_catalog = true, $enforce_token_bind = 'permissive', $check_revocations_for_cached = false, $hash_algorithms = 'md5', $identity_uri = false, $admin_tenant_name = 'admin', # Deprecated params $admin_token = undef, $auth_admin_prefix = undef, $auth_host = undef, $auth_port = undef, $auth_protocol = undef, $auth_url = undef, $auth_plugin = undef, if $auth_admin_prefix or $auth_host or $auth_port or $auth_protocol or $auth_url or $auth_plugin { warn('Use of the auth_admin_prefix, auth_host, auth_port, auth_protocol, admin_token configuration options is deprecated') create_resources($name, {'keystone_authtoken/auth_plugin' => {'value' => $auth_plugin}}) } create_resources($name, {'keystone_authtoken/auth_uri' => {'value' => $auth_uri}}) create_resources($name, {'keystone_authtoken/admin_user' => {'value' => $admin_user}}) create_resources($name, {'keystone_authtoken/admin_password' => {'value' => $admin_password, 'secret' => true}}) if $auth_version { create_resources($name, {'keystone_authtoken/auth_version' => { value => $auth_version }}) } else { create_resources($name, {'keystone_authtoken/auth_version' => { ensure => absent }}) } if $delay_auth_decision { create_resources($name, {'keystone_authtoken/delay_auth_decision' => { value => $delay_auth_decision }}) } else { create_resources($name, {'keystone_authtoken/delay_auth_decision' => { ensure => absent }}) } create_resources($name, {'keystone_authtoken/insecure' => { value => $insecure}})
deleted_lines: # config resource. It supports all of the authentication parameters specified # at http://www.jamielennox.net/blog/2015/02/17/loading-authentication-plugins/ # with the addition of the default domain for user and project.# == Parameters:# The name of the resource corresponding to the config file. For example,# string; required# [*username*] # The name of the service user; # string; required# [*password*] # Password to create for the service user; # string; required# [*auth_url*] # The URL to use for authentication. # string; required# [*auth_plugin*] # The plugin to use for authentication. # string; optional: default to 'password'# [*user_id*] # The ID of the service user; # string; optional: default to undef# [*user_domain_name*] # (Optional) Name of domain for $username # Defaults to undef# [*user_domain_id*] # (Optional) ID of domain for $username # Defaults to undef# [*project_name*] # Service project name; # string; optional: default to undef# [*project_id*] # Service project ID; # string; optional: default to undef # # [*project_domain_name*] # (Optional) Name of domain for $project_name # Defaults to undef # # [*project_domain_id*] # (Optional) ID of domain for $project_name # Defaults to undef # # [*domain_name*] # (Optional) Use this for auth to obtain a domain-scoped token. # If using this option, do not specify $project_name or $project_id. # Defaults to undef # # [*domain_id*] # (Optional) Use this for auth to obtain a domain-scoped token. # If using this option, do not specify $project_name or $project_id. # Defaults to undef # # [*default_domain_name*] # (Optional) Name of domain for $username and $project_name # If user_domain_name is not specified, use $default_domain_name # If project_domain_name is not specified, use $default_domain_name # Defaults to undef # # [*default_domain_id*] # (Optional) ID of domain for $user_id and $project_id # If user_domain_id is not specified, use $default_domain_id # If project_domain_id is not specified, use $default_domain_id # Defaults to undef # # [*trust_id*] # (Optional) Trust ID # Defaults to undef # # [*cacert*] # (Optional) CA certificate file for TLS (https) # Defaults to undef # # [*cert*] # (Optional) Certificate file for TLS (https) # Defaults to undef # # [*key*] # (Optional) Key file for TLS (https) # Defaults to undef# If true, explicitly allow TLS without checking server cert against any # certificate authorities. WARNING: not recommended. Use with caution. # boolean; Defaults to false (which means be secure) $username, $password, $auth_url, $auth_plugin = 'password', $user_id = undef, $user_domain_name = undef, $user_domain_id = undef, $project_name = undef, $project_id = undef, $project_domain_name = undef, $project_domain_id = undef, $domain_name = undef, $domain_id = undef, $default_domain_name = undef, $default_domain_id = undef, $trust_id = undef, $cacert = undef, $cert = undef, $key = undef, $insecure = false, if !$project_name and !$project_id and !$domain_name and !$domain_id { fail('Must specify either a project (project_name or project_id, for a project scoped token) or a domain (domain_name or domain_id, for a domain scoped token)') } if ($project_name or $project_id) and ($domain_name or $domain_id) { fail('Cannot specify both a project (project_name or project_id) and a domain (domain_name or domain_id)') } $user_and_domain_array = split($username, '::') $real_username = $user_and_domain_array[0] $real_user_domain_name = pick($user_domain_name, $user_and_domain_array[1], $default_domain_name, '__nodomain__') $project_and_domain_array = split($project_name, '::') $real_project_name = $project_and_domain_array[0] $real_project_domain_name = pick($project_domain_name, $project_and_domain_array[1], $default_domain_name, '__nodomain__') create_resources($name, {'keystone_authtoken/auth_plugin' => {'value' => $auth_plugin}}) create_resources($name, {'keystone_authtoken/auth_url' => {'value' => $auth_url}}) create_resources($name, {'keystone_authtoken/username' => {'value' => $real_username}}) create_resources($name, {'keystone_authtoken/password' => {'value' => $password, 'secret' => true}}) if $user_id { == '__nodomain__' { create_resources($name, {'keystone_authtoken/user_domain_name' => {'ensure' => 'absent'}}) } else { create_resources($name, {'keystone_authtoken/user_domain_name' => {'value' => $real_user_domain_name}}) } if $user_domain_id { create_resources($name, {'keystone_authtoken/user_domain_id' => {'value' => $user_domain_id}}) } elsif $default_domain_id { create_resources($name, {'keystone_authtoken/user_domain_id' => {'value' => $default_domain_id}}) } else { create_resources($name, {'keystone_authtoken/user_domain_id' => {'ensure' => 'absent'}}) } if $project_name { create_resources($name, {'keystone_authtoken/project_name' => {'value' => $real_project_name}}) } else { create_resources($name, {'keystone_authtoken/project_name' => {'ensure' => 'absent'}}) } if $project_id { create_resources($name, {'keystone_authtoken/project_id' => {'value' => $project_id}}) } else { create_resources($name, {'keystone_authtoken/project_id' => {'ensure' => 'absent'}}) } if $real_project_domain_name == '__nodomain__' { create_resources($name, {'keystone_authtoken/project_domain_name' => {'ensure' => 'absent'}}) } else { create_resources($name, {'keystone_authtoken/project_domain_name' => {'value' => $real_project_domain_name}}) } if $project_domain_id { create_resources($name, {'keystone_authtoken/project_domain_id' => {'value' => $project_domain_id}}) } elsif $default_domain_id { create_resources($name, {'keystone_authtoken/project_domain_id' => {'value' => $default_domain_id}}) } else { create_resources($name, {'keystone_authtoken/project_domain_id' => {'ensure' => 'absent'}}) } if $domain_name { create_resources($name, {'keystone_authtoken/domain_name' => {'value' => $domain_name}}) } else { create_resources($name, {'keystone_authtoken/domain_name' => {'ensure' => 'absent'}}) } if $domain_id { create_resources($name, {'keystone_authtoken/domain_id' => {'value' => $domain_id}}) } else { create_resources($name, {'keystone_authtoken/domain_id' => {'ensure' => 'absent'}}) } if $trust_id { create_resources($name, {'keystone_authtoken/trust_id' => {'value' => $trust_id}}) } else { create_resources($name, {'keystone_authtoken/trust_id' => {'ensure' => 'absent'}}) } if $cacert { create_resources($name, {'keystone_authtoken/cacert' => {'value' => $cacert}}) } else { create_resources($name, {'keystone_authtoken/cacert' => {'ensure' => 'absent'}}) } if $cert { create_resources($name, {'keystone_authtoken/cert' => {'value' => $cert}}) } else { create_resources($name, {'keystone_authtoken/cert' => {'ensure' => 'absent'}}) } if $key { create_resources($name, {'keystone_authtoken/key' => {'value' => $key}}) } else { create_resources($name, {'keystone_authtoken/key' => {'ensure' => 'absent'}}) } create_resources($name, {'keystone_authtoken/insecure' => {'value' => $insecure}})

subject: Add actions for renaming volume host attr
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-22 09:54:55.000000000', 'files': ['actions/actions.py', 'actions/volume-host-add-driver', 'unit_tests/test_actions_cinder_manage.py', 'actions/cinder_manage.py', 'unit_tests/__init__.py', 'actions/remove-services', 'actions/rename-volume-host', 'actions.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-cinder/commit/d21160a0d354a815b563d55a33d204c210e815cf', 'message': 'Add actions for renaming volume host attr

Add two new actions which are essentially wrappers around

cinder-manage volume update_host \
    --currenthost CURRENTHOST \
    --newhost NEWHOST

In previous versions of the charm if block-device is set or the
legacy ceph relation is used (as opposed to storage-backend relation)
then the configuration of those backends is done in the [DEFAULT]
section of the cinder.conf. As of Ocata that is no longer supported
and backends need to be listed in their own sections and referenced
via enable_backends parameter. This change in config results in a
change of host name and existing volumes need to have their metadata
updated to point at the new hostname.

Old Hostname: <unit-name>
New Hostname: <unit-name>@<backend section name>#<volume-backend-name>

New Action: volume-backend-name
Used for updating the host attribute of volumes to add the driver
name. This is needed after an upgrade to Ocata if there are existing
volumes which have been configured prior to multi-backends
being enabled.

New Action: rename-volume-host
Used for updating the host attribute of volumes. This action is
a lower level action then volume-host-add-driver and simply passes
the old and new hosts verbatim to cinder-manage.

Change-Id: I989074a3f41126aa57c514f7e18b887733bc18fe
Partial-Bug: #1665272
'}]
commit_message:
Add actions for renaming volume host attr

Add two new actions which are essentially wrappers around

cinder-manage volume update_host \
    --currenthost CURRENTHOST \
    --newhost NEWHOST

In previous versions of the charm if block-device is set or the
legacy ceph relation is used (as opposed to storage-backend relation)
then the configuration of those backends is done in the [DEFAULT]
section of the cinder.conf. As of Ocata that is no longer supported
and backends need to be listed in their own sections and referenced
via enable_backends parameter. This change in config results in a
change of host name and existing volumes need to have their metadata
updated to point at the new hostname.

Old Hostname: <unit-name>
New Hostname: <unit-name>@<backend section name>#<volume-backend-name>

New Action: volume-backend-name
Used for updating the host attribute of volumes to add the driver
name. This is needed after an upgrade to Ocata if there are existing
volumes which have been configured prior to multi-backends
being enabled.

New Action: rename-volume-host
Used for updating the host attribute of volumes. This action is
a lower level action then volume-host-add-driver and simply passes
the old and new hosts verbatim to cinder-manage.

Change-Id: I989074a3f41126aa57c514f7e18b887733bc18fe

commit_message:
Use containers uploads template from upstream

The tripleo-common project already maintains a list of containers to
pull to the local registry. Use it instead of building our own and keep
it the single source of truth.

Depends-On: Ifc0939d08ac9a9d35745c81a6a5f719ccee02b04
Change-Id: If6df944dc52f25cc84d3015548f76178fb61740c

commit_message:
Rely on docker being available in the undercloud

Starting from Ocata, the undercloud already has docker installed and
enabled. There is not much value in deploying a containerized overcloud
prior to Ocata as it was experimental and the TripleO container
architecture is being completely revamped anyway.

Change-Id: I71c35fc416d7b91a4ebf7c103e04163d7ea560a5

commit_message:
Add missing container images

A few patches recently merged that added new container images. This
patch adds them to the overcloud_containers.yaml file so that they can
easily be imported into a local registry.

Change-Id: Ib20b71f6e35a9b4a93857e8e5d5be811b1ef68cf

commit_message:
Add serial mode to all-plugin tox environment

This commit adds a new tox environment, all-plugin-serial, which adds
the option to have the all-plugin run in serial mode.

Change-Id: Ib4ea2cb355bdbcb2abfd7059e96f13099d71a7da
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/60/434860/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [testenv:all-plugin-serial] sitepackages = True # 'all' includes slow tests setenv = {[tempestenv]setenv} OS_TEST_TIMEOUT={env:OS_TEST_TIMEOUT:1200} deps = {[tempestenv]deps} commands = find . -type f -name "*.pyc" -delete tempest run --serial --regex {posargs}

commit_message:
Cap the number of worker threads

Users can configure the number of worker threads however when it's
not specified the calculated number of workers can get too large on
hosts with a large number of CPUs.

Change-Id: I10a653dda7444b756fede74ce434b9038415c74c
(cherry picked from commit bf6e06e666fa8d062d9de36f6ec3adca1576eec3)

commit_message:
Put DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG to quotes

In case the DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG variable contains multiline strings we
need to obey them in local.conf.

Co-Authored-By: Dariusz Smigiel <smigiel.dariusz@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I721abe99d2ea1058bdb9584e4d94567423ff5ccd
Related-bug: 1667331

commit_message:
Add floating ip with process creating instance

This patch resolves problem adding floating ip
and adds role for grenade user that emerged with keystone API v3

Closes-Bug: #1652657
Closes-Bug: #1652746

Change-Id: I2a19cc8e5cc60ef076cfea335c7704cceaa561b0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/grenade refs/changes/01/410701/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Add the member role to the new project and user openstack role add --project $NOVA_PROJECT --user $NOVA_USER Member # openstack server create --image $DEFAULT_IMAGE_NAME \ # --flavor $DEFAULT_INSTANCE_TYPE \ # --security-group $NOVA_USER \ # $net \ # $NOVA_SERVER --wait #openstack server add floating ip $NOVA_SERVER $ip openstack server create --image $DEFAULT_IMAGE_NAME \ --flavor $DEFAULT_INSTANCE_TYPE \ --security-group $NOVA_USER \ $net \ --nic v4-fixed-ip=$ip \ $NOVA_SERVER --wait
deleted_lines: openstack server create --image $DEFAULT_IMAGE_NAME \ --flavor $DEFAULT_INSTANCE_TYPE \ --security-group $NOVA_USER \ $net \ $NOVA_SERVER --wait openstack server add floating ip $NOVA_SERVER $ip

commit_message:
Compress murano-dashboard JS scripts within a common context

This patch moves all murano-dashboard JS scripts to ADD_JS_FILES
setting and gets rid of murano_base.html template which sole purpose
is including these scripts.
This can fix the render issue in Components tab.

Change-Id: If14e3bd4ea9764857deb7a2997d3d2d0f4daba7c
Closes-Bug: #1654809
Co-Authored-By: Timur Sufiev <tsufiev@mirantis.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano-dashboard refs/changes/13/422413/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {% extends 'base.html' %}

commit_message:
Add missing i18n strings to the DataTable component

* The "Filter" string in the filter input field at the top of the table
* The "Show x of y" string at the top of the table

Closes-Bug: #1662976
Change-Id: I28cba7b721cd469663f4de091bcdc0a5979a4927

commit_message:
Install ipxe-roms-qemu from base repo for EL distros

Version included in base repos should be valid since 7.3 so
we shouldn't force pre-installation anymore, it will just get
picked up as requirement for qemu-kvm.

Change-Id: I9e93ce8dc592dea7c47cb01c806a02ef902db9b5

commit_message:
Increase ansible-pacemaker default service start timeout

We are passing 200 but in some environments this has been seen to
expire by a few seconds.

Change-Id: I5c2270559339ea9ee0043b7a2e519e26d4d9d78a
Closes-Bug: 1666604

commit_message:
Teach the requirements parsing code to ignore comments

If we add comments to upper-constraints.txt we'll fail validation
This change allows upper-constratints.txt

Change-Id: Ic9b54de22238593c75592c4bdd295c5619cb34b1
